title: Acoustic Guitar
text:
</>
 </>
 </>
Quick Use </>
 </>
Legendary </>
 </>
Acoustic Guitar </>
 </>
A playable acoustic guitar used to attract ARC's attention, and impress other Raiders. </>
 </>
Weight </>
1.0 </>
 </>
Stack Size </>
1 </>
 </>
Sell Price </>
7,000 </>
The Acoustic Guitar is a Gadget that Raiders can use to play one of seven different melodies. </>
While playing, you'll be unable to use other weapons, gadgets, breach, or search containers unless the instrument is unequipped (similar to carrying a Field Crate ). Because the Acoustic Guitar requires both hands to play, actions such as opening doors or riding ziplines cannot be performed while playing. </>
Raiders can group with others who have Recorders and Shakers to make a musical ensemble! </>

title: After Rain Comes
text:
</>
 </>
After Rain Comes </>
 </>
Trader </>
Celeste </>
 </>
Location </>
Buried City </>
 </>
Related Quests </>
 </>
Previous </>
Eyes In The Sky </>
 </>
Next </>
- </>
After Rain Comes is a quest given by Celeste . </>
Objectives </>
Find the flooded solar panels nearby the Grandioso Apartments The panels are in the north side of the pond east of the building itself </>
The panels are in the north side of the pond east of the building itself </>
Repair the solar panels using 5 Wires and 2 Battery </>
Granted </>
1x Zipline </>
Rewards </>
5x Blue Light Stick </>
3x Antiseptic </>
5x Durable Cloth </>
Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
I know, I know! The power's down in sector—  Oh, hey. A flash flood took out some of our solar panels in Buried City, and the generators only hold on for so long. </>
Do us all a solid when you're up there, OK? </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
The flooded solar panels are in the southwest of Buried City, nearby the Grandioso Apartments. </>
Idle: </>
Be on your guard, when you go there—I've had a lot of reports of gunfire in that area. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
Celeste here: The flooded solar panels are nearby the Grandioso Apartments. Watch your back, Raider. </>
Upon Completion: </>
Thanks for fixing those solar panels; I was worried we'd lost all of them to the floods. </>

title: Apollo
text:
Speranza isn’t Apollo’s first rodeo. A traveling mechanic, Apollo has chosen Speranza as his home for the time being, fixing up whatever Raiders need fixing. While he can at times seem cryptic about his past, Apollo can’t help but try and make wherever he is a better place. Whether that’s running a kids’ football team, or keeping the library stocked with books, Apollo knows there’s more to life than just survival. [ 1 ] </>
When he's not dealing in explosives, Apollo is an avid flute player, so pray he won't blow his fingers off. </>
Shop </>
Quests </>
Check out the Quests overview page for more information. </>
References </>
↑ https://arcraiders.com/news/meet-the-traders-blog </>

Apricot Tree </>
1-4 Apricots spawn on the ground below this style of tree. It is not guaranteed that an Apricot will spawn, however you may be able to interact with the tree, dropping between 1-3 apricots. Note the interact prompt may not always appear, it is best to do a small loop around the tree. </>
The number of fruit dropped can be influenced by the map modifier/event. </>
The Apricot Tree can be identified by its combination of green and yellow leaves, spindly shape and small size. </>

title: ARC
text:
ARC are the most common enemy you'll face as a Raider. They are deadly machines that rain from the sky to ravage the surface of the Rust Belt. </>
They range from small, unassuming forms like roaming Surveyors and feisty Ticks to towering, multi-legged behemoths that dominate the landscape. Each ARC variant has its own strengths, weaknesses, and attack patterns, requiring different strategies to defeat. </>
ARC Behavior Stages </>
ARC have 3 behavior stages based on detection. Each stage is identified by the light emitted from the ARC's scanner. </>
A Blue Scanner indicates the ARC is patrolling or has no target. </>
A Yellow Scanner indicates the ARC is alerted to a player's presence or is cautious. </>
A Red Scanner indicates the ARC has found a target. </>
Note: ARC can jump straight to red from blue if shot. The scanner gradually shifts from red and yellow if a player is or is not within its scanner. </>

ARC Husks and ARC Probes </>
Husks are dynamic spawning, lootable, destroyed and long forgotten ARC scattered throughout the landscape Topside . </>
ARC Probes come and go throughout your time Topside but will land in predetermined positions for some time before leaving after they've collected enough data. Sometimes you can find damaged versions of ARC Probes that have been knocked over. </>

ARC Plating </>
ARC have different types of plating that can tell you at a glance how armored an ARC is or where their weak-points are. A general rule of thumb for dealing with ARC is that weapons with higher ARC Armor Penetration will be more effective. </>
Unarmored Plating is distinguished by its matte, white coloring. All weapons are semi-effective against Unarmored Plating although rounds with Moderate ARC Armor Penetration or above will be the most effective. </>
Armored Plating is distinguished by its shiny, dark gray coloring. Rounds with or above Moderate ARC Armor Penetration are needed to damage Armored Plating as anything below Moderate will bounce off. Damaging Armored Plating can strip it off, revealing weaker plating. </>
Weak-Points are distinguished by their matte, bright yellow coloring. Damaging Weak-Points deals direct damage to ARC and should be the priority when attacking. </>

Probes come down from space regularly throughout the match, and can often be seen returning after a period of time. They're said to collect soil samples before returning, although it's assumed that they're taking air/environmental samples as well. Their purpose is unknown, but the fact that they continue to arrive tells us that they haven't found what they're looking for... yet. </>
When they land, they emit a beep that can be heard from quite a distance. They are breachable with three different panels opening for loot. </>
https://arcraiders.wiki/wiki/File:Arc-Raiders-Probe.mp3 </>

ARC Alloy </>
ARC Circuitry </>
ARC Motion Core </>
ARC Powercell </>
ARC Items* </>
*Every ARC has a slightly different loot pool of alternate ARC related recyclables </>
Lore </>
After Completing the quest: A Bad Feeling A cutscene plays revealing that the purpose of the ARC Probe is to scan the ground in an attempt to find Speranza . Celeste says bad things happened when others were found. </>

title: ARC Surveyor
text:
</>
 </>
 </>
ARC Surveyor </>
 </>
Shani: They're often more scared of you than you are of them, but in a panic, they'll bulldoze you all the same. </>
 </>
Threat Level </>
Low </>
 </>
Armor </>
Heavy </>
 </>
Primary Attack </>
Rolling </>
 </>
Abilities </>
None </>
 </>
Weakness </>
Core </>
 </>
Stats </>
 </>
Health </>
257 [ 1 ] </>
The Surveyor is an unarmed, spherical ARC machine completely protected by an armored shell. </>
Behavior </>
The Surveyor is typically observed shooting a blue laser beam into the sky using a telescopic tool. As it does this, its armor plating is retracted and its vulnerable core is exposed. Presumably, the Surveyor's laser is used to communicate with ARC infrastructure and/or units in orbit. </>
The Surveyor can easily sense approaching Raiders . Once threatened, it will immediately finish what its doing and roll away at a speed faster than a Raider can sprint. Although it prefers to escape engagements, the Surveyor will not hesitate to roll into its attacker if left with no other option but to defend itself. This attack does a moderate amount of damage. Once it senses danger has passed, the Surveyor will resume its transmission. </>
While uncommon, the Surveyor has been observed rolling off ledges in certain scenarios when escaping an attacker. </>
Combat </>
Destroying the Surveyor can be tricky because it will immediately roll away at high speed when threatened or attacked. To quickly destroy the Surveyor, the best strategy is to first delay its escape by stunning it with a Hornet Driver or Showstopper while it's still exposing its core, and then throwing powerful explosives like Heavy Fuze Grenades to finish it off. </>
As the Surveyor takes damage, its armored panels can break off and be looted. Heavy Ammo is more effective at shedding its armor plating than most other Ammo types. </>
Loot </>
The Surveyor Vault is a unique item dropped by the Surveyor that's used to upgrade the Medical Lab . </>
Codex Entry </>
Evasive and mysterious, the ARC Surveyor is known amongst Raiders as a rich source of high-value ARC tech. </>
The Surveyor has been observed to roam the surface, and is believed to fill up data-banks with all kinds of measurements and analyses. </>
Although unarmed, it should be noted that the ARC Surveyor is not without defensive capabilities. If provoked, it may launch an attack and try to ram whomever is close by. </>
References </>
↑ Health value is currently estimated; not based on a reliable source. </>

Armored Transports is a Quest given by Tian Wen after completing A New Type Of Plant and With A Trace . </>
Objectives </>
Reach the Checkpoint </>
Search the Guard huts for a Armored Patrol Key Card Note: If the player dies while carrying the Key Card, a Spare Key will be available to loot inside a Security Hut nearby to the Patrol Cars. </>
Note: If the player dies while carrying the Key Card, a Spare Key will be available to loot inside a Security Hut nearby to the Patrol Cars. </>
Reach the Traffic Tunnel near the Blue Gate Checkpoint </>
Find and unlock the rear door of an armored patrol car Note: There are multiple of these cars inside the tunnel, but the location of the locked car is randomized - you will have to find it on your own. It is unclear whether there is only one locked car or whether multiple can spawn. It is also unclear whether multiple players can open the same car for the quest objective. </>
Note: There are multiple of these cars inside the tunnel, but the location of the locked car is randomized - you will have to find it on your own. It is unclear whether there is only one locked car or whether multiple can spawn. It is also unclear whether multiple players can open the same car for the quest objective. </>
Rewards </>
Aviator Outfit (Blue Yellow Color) </>
3x Smoke Grenade </>
3x Defibrillator </>
Guide </>
Armored Patrol Key Card location </>
Armored Patrol Key Card object </>
Tunnel Entrance location </>
One of the locked car locations </>
One of the locked cars </>
If this quest is active and you have already picked up the key card from the guard shack outside the tunnel, but it is not in your inventory, you can find a "spare key card" in a box on the floor of a guard shack just inside the right entrance of the tunnel. </>
Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
Ever since we expanded the tunnels to the Blue Gate, some rare pieces have started appearing on the black market. </>
Meanwhile, I'm stuck here peddling battered old Rattlers. If I don't find new supply lines, I'll be left in the dust. </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
There's some armored transports among the pileup by the gate. Find a way in, and see what you can find. </>
Idle: </>
If there's one thing I've learned, it's that locked doors tend to guard the tastiest of hauls. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
This is Tian Wen speaking. The armored transports are in the car pileup by the gate, but they seem to be locked with a key card of sorts. You'll find a way in, I'm sure. </>
Upon Completion: </>
Managed to crack open an armored transport, huh? That's promising. Very promising. </>

Harvest object </>
Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
Our food production is finally enough to meet our basic needs, but what we really need now is variety. I have a lead on some agricultural research from before the First Wave. Are you in? </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
Great. My lead points to a group of researchers that worked out of the Research & Administration building by the Dam, so that'd be a good place to start. </>
Idle: </>
Even Ben Welder can only do so much with beans and potatoes, you know what I mean? </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
This is Celeste speaking. Our lead points to the Research & Administration building, east of the Dam. See if you can find any traces of an agricultural research project. </>
Upon Completion: </>
I see. Looks like they were actually trying to cultivate an entirely new species. </>

</>

Dialog </>
We're short on everything but mouths to feed, yet Celeste's launching precious supplies into the air for Raiders to claw over. I'm done letting the good stuff go to waste. </>

title: A First Foothold
text:
</>
 </>
A First Foothold </>
 </>
Trader </>
Apollo </>
 </>
Location </>
The Blue Gate </>
 </>
Related Quests </>
 </>
Previous </>
- </>
 </>
Next </>
Reduced To Rubble </>
A First Foothold is a quest given by Apollo </>
Requirements </>
Unlock The Blue Gate map </>
Objectives </>
Stabilize the observation deck near the Ridgeline </>
Enable the comms terminal near the Olive Grove </>
Rotate the satellite dishes on the church roof, north of the Data Vault </>
Nail down the roof plates on the Raider structure near Trapper's Glade </>
Granted Items </>
2x Noisemaker </>
Rewards </>
3x Shrapnel Grenade </>
2x Snap Blast Grenade </>
3x Heavy Fuze Grenade </>
Guide </>
Observation deck near Ridgeline </>
Map showing the location of the observation deck </>
The observation deck in the game world. Interact with the sides of the deck. </>
Comms terminal near Olive Grove </>
Map showing the location of the comms terminal. </>
The comms terminal in the game world. Interact with the Orange Terminal. </>
Satellite dishes on the church roof near Data Center </>
Map showing the location of the Church with the satellite dish. </>
The Church with the satellite dish in the game World. Climb the scaffolding to reach the satellite dish. </>
Raider structure near Trapper's Glade </>
Map showing the location of the raider structure. </>
The raider structure in the game world. Interact with the top of the structure to fix the roof plates. </>
Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
We’ve only just finished expanding the Tube network towards the Blue Gate, and we’re still laboring away at the rest. </>
My crew’s been building new infrastructure around the valley to safeguard our Raiders, but the constant ARC threat has made it difficult to get anything done. </>
Idle: </>
We've had to build our Topside infrastructure in stages. Our engineers keep being chased off by one danger or another. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
This is Apollo. Gate still standing, Raider? You'll find the unfinished structures scattered across the valley; look for construction signs and cones. My previous crew came under heavy fire before they could finish up. </>
Upon Completing Olive Grove Objective: </>
Testing, testing: comms seems to be working! And hey, while you're there: Shani picked up a major rumble near your location. Do you see any sign of a collapse nearby? </>
Upon Completion: </>
Thanks, Raider; soon enough we'll feel right at home around the Blue Gate. </>

title: A Lay Of The Land
text:
</>
 </>
A Lay Of The Land </>
 </>

Shani </>

In One Round </>

Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
Those distant rumbles are getting less distant with each passing day. </>
I have a lead on some LiDAR scanners that may help us monitor the tremors. You do want to keep a roof over your head, don't you? </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
The foreman worked at the Jiangsu Warehouse, in the northwest of the Spaceport. See what you can find about a shipment of LiDAR scanners. </>
Idle: </>
It can be hard to hear the tremors over all the petty squabbling, but I assure you: they're there. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
Shani here. The foreman may have left notes on where to find the LiDAR scanners. See if you can find any in the Jiangsu Warehouse. </>
Upon Completion: </>
Excellent, these are just what I need. Now, you're not afraid of heights, are you? </>

title: A New Type Of Plant
text:
</>
 </>
A New Type Of Plant </>
 </>
Trader </>
Lance </>
 </>
Location </>
Dam Battlegrounds </>
 </>

 </>

A New Type Of Plant is a Quest given by Lance after completing Building A Library . </>

In One Round </>
Search for the new plant near the Baron Husk in the Old Battleground </>
Deliver the Possibly Toxic Plant to Lance </>
Rewards </>
1× Vita Shot </>
5× Antiseptic </>
Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
Some scouts have been bringing back reports of these weird plants spreading into the area. Now, this makes your old pal Lance think it may have some interesting uses. </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
Head out there into the Dam Battlegrounds and go get me a sample. I heard the spores themselves can be a bit toxic though, so watch out. </>
Idle: </>
My mind is a-buzz with ideas of what we could do with these plants. Super fast growing foods, instant effect medicine, fun party tricks. Who knows! </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
Can you hear me? I'm connected directly to the feed. Ah... you can't answer me anyway: A little birdie told me they saw the plants growing on the Baron Husk out by the Old Battleground. Might be just the place to collect a sample. </>
Upon Completion: </>
Looks like I got plenty to experiment with: these plants have somehow mutated together with fungi to form a symbiotic life form capable of spreading at record speed. My appreciations to you! </>

Pharmacy location near Piazza Arbusto You can often find boxes behind the counters of the many pharmacies on the map. A recommended location is the pharmacy in Piazza Arbusto close east of the Town Hall </>
Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
I got my hands on a fancy new ESR Analyzer; had a whole big reveal planned. One minute it's here, next minute-poof. Please help? </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
I found my original analyzer at a pharmacy in Buried City; see if you can find me a spare, OK friendo? </>
Idle: </>
An ESR analyzer is used to test the blood. I was going to use it on myself, first. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
Hello, this is Lance. Yes, I got your frequency. See if you can't find a spare ESR analyzer in any of the pharmacies, OK? I have a pre-painted reveal banner that depends on it. </>
Upon Completion: </>
You found a spare unit? Excellent! Now, to figure out what ESR stands for... </>

title: A Symbol Of Unification
text:
</>
 </>
A Symbol Of Unification </>
 </>
Trader </>
Celeste </>
 </>
Location </>
Dam Battlegrounds </>
 </>
Related Quests </>
 </>

 </>

A Symbol Of Unification is a Quest given by Celeste after completing Unexpected Initiative . </>
Objectives </>
In One Round </>
Reach the Formicai Outpost in Dam Battlegrounds </>
Locate the flag at the Formicai Outpost </>
Hoist the flag on the small platform overlooking the Red Lake </>
Rewards </>
Aviator Outfit (Dusted Cream Color) </>
3× Mod Components </>
5× Duct Tape </>
Guide </>
Find the Formicai Outpost on the southmost hill located on Dam Battlegrounds. </>
Inside the outpost, grab the flag from the bag located on the medical bed. </>
On the balcony, place the flag and complete the quest. </>
Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
Y'Know, back in the day we actually used to have a flag - well , a scrap of cloth more than anything. Still, seeing it meant you knew you  had allies nearby, that you were on your own home turf. So, I was thinking... </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
You catch on quickly. Hoist it where people can see it, alright? Doesn't have to be flashy; a small reminder is enough. </>
Idle: </>
We were more united, back during the First Wave. We had to be, when the machines came down. Seeking shelter down here saved us, but it also made a lot of people forget what's up there, and why it should matter to us. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
This is Celeste: Hoist those flags up high, where people can see. Let them remember what it felt like to stand side by side. </>
Upon Completion: </>
"A Symbol of Unification" video plays. </>

Search the swamp for traces of the barrel's origins </>

Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
We've got clean water again, but we can't risk people falling ill if the saboteurs return. We need to root them out once and for all. </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
All right: head back to that barrel you found, and see if you can find any clues as to its origins. </>
Idle: </>
No one sabotages Speranza's drinking water on my watch. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
This is Shani. Hope you hear me alright. The water intake below the Water Treatment Control building is the most likely place to find evidence of sabotage. I'd start there, if I were you. </>
Upon Completion: </>
They left a key in the truck, huh? That's certainly something to go on. You up for a trip to the Spaceport? </>

Intro/Description: </>
A customer of mine saw a family taking cover in an old encampment in Buried City. I'll pay anyone who manages to find them and escort them back to safety. </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
Thank you. I'll clear everything with Celeste later, just do your best to find them. </>
Idle: </>
Petitioning for a rescue team would take time, but with ARC out there we ain't got any. Especially if there are children involved. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
Apollo here. See if you can find any traces of that family, and please hurry. They were last seen in a camp on the abandoned highway. </>
Upon Completion: </>
Man, I really hoped... Thank you for trying. With luck, maybe the rest of the family can make it to safety. Here; take the reward anyway. </>

Intro/Description: </>
Guess what? Shani asked me to help out with something, and for once, I'm actually glad she did. We're setting up new outposts topside! Or, planning to, at least. Can you believe it? </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
Here's a list of buildings that could make for potential outposts. Mark them with paint for us, so the crew know where to go. </>

As excited as I am about this, we can't forget that any topside presence is risky. Keep it simple: paint, move on, next building. Quick work. </>

You marked them? Perfect. Those marks will hold until we've got boots on the ground. ...Man, new outposts. </>

title: Bastion
text:
</>
 </>
 </>
Bastion </>
 </>
Shani: Their front plating is nearly impenetrable. You'll need to bring more firepower if you hope to stand a chance. </>
 </>
Threat Level </>
Critical </>
 </>
Armor </>
Heavy </>
 </>
Primary Attack </>
Projectile Volley </>
 </>
Abilities </>
None </>
 </>
Weakness </>
Rear Plate Leg Joints </>
 </>
Stats </>
 </>
Health </>
2050 [ 1 ] </>
Covered in thick plating, the Bastion is a fortress on legs. While it may be slow, it absolutely dominates wherever it patrols with heavy gatling-gun fire; turning anyone who gets in its way into Swiss cheese. </>
Based on Raider observations of its behavior, the Bastion is believed to be deployed where ARC detects potential resource deposits worth defending at all costs. </>
Attack </>
Emits a loud screech before unloading its gatling-gun for 3 seconds at the last seen position of any Raiders. </>
Combat Tips </>
Bastions have unarmored yellow leg joints and a yellow canister on their rear that deal direct damage, shooting these areas is the fastest way to destroy it. Destroying its rear canister or any of the leg joints stuns it for a short time, making this stun window a good time to shoot it. Destroying the canister also peels back its rear plate, revealing its true weak-spot, a large barrel-like part that when shot deals major damage to the Bastion. Blaze Grenades and to a lesser extent Snap Blast Grenades are also an effective way of dealing damage. Deadline can also instantly defeat a Bastion when deployed near the canister. </>
Attacks can be avoided by </>
Moving behind cover </>
Staying out of line of sight when it is alerted </>
Hiding in buildings or thick foliage </>
Loot </>
The Bastion Cell is a unique item dropped by the Bastion that's used to upgrade the Gear Bench . </>
Locations </>
Bastions can be found on all maps, generally in wide open areas (Not all locations are listed yet; currently based on Raider testimonies): </>
Dam Battlegrounds East of Water Treatment Control Red Lakes Balcony </>
East of Water Treatment Control </>
Red Lakes Balcony </>
Buried City Market Ruins Marano Park North of Plaza Rosa </>
Market Ruins </>
Marano Park </>
North of Plaza Rosa </>
Spaceport Southwest of the West Hangar Southwest of the East Hangar Southwest of the Launch Tower East of Vehicle Maintenance </>
Southwest of the West Hangar </>
Southwest of the East Hangar </>
Southwest of the Launch Tower </>
East of Vehicle Maintenance </>
The Blue Gate Outer Gates </>
Outer Gates </>
Stella Montis Loading Bay </>
Loading Bay </>
Codex Entry </>
Covered in thick plating, the Bastion is a fortress on legs. While it may be slow, it absolutely dominates wherever it patrols with heavy gatling-gun fire; turning anyone who gets in its way into Swiss cheese. </>
Based on Raider observations of its behavior, the Bastion is believed to be deployed where ARC detects potential resource deposits worth defending at all costs. </>
It is much easier to try hampering the Bastion's movement by destroying its legs, which may also help in getting clear shots at its unplated back. </>
References </>
↑ Health value is currently an estimate; not based on a reliable source. </>

title: Bees!
text:
</>
 </>
Bees! </>
 </>
Trader </>
Celeste </>
 </>
Location </>
The Blue Gate </>
 </>
Related Quests </>
 </>
Previous </>
Flickering Threat </>
 </>
Next </>
Espresso </>
Bees! is a Quest given by Celeste after completing Flickering Threat . </>
Objectives </>
In One Round </>
Reach the Olive Grove in Blue Gate </>
Search the bee hives around the Olive Grove </>
Granted Items </>
5x Yellow Light Stick </>
Rewards </>
1x Advanced Electrical Components </>
3x Sensors </>
Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
Bees! There are bees still around! While I'm no expert, our greenhouse crew desperately wants some. </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
They were spotted near the Blue Gate. Be careful when collecting the bees, though. They can sting, and they die if they do so. We need them alive if they're to be of any use. </>
Idle: </>
I heard stories of bees when I was a kid. They fly around and help plants grow even better. Nasty sting though, but potentially worth it if we can use them to improve our crops. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
Celeste speaking: Our scouts spotted beehives on some old sheds to the south-east. There should be an olive grove around there. Perk up your ears. If you hear a buzzing noise, they can't be far away. </>
Awaiting Completion: </>
Did you do it? Did you find bees? </>
Upon Completion: </>
You did it! Bees! The greenhouse is not gonna believe this. It's amazing these little things survived the Collapse somehow. Amazing. </>

title: The Blue Gate
text:
</>
 </>
The Blue Gate </>
 </>
Once a steadfast symbol of defiant connection, the Blue Gate now serves as a daunting entryway into the perilous mountain ranges. The surrounding valley bears scars both new and old. </>
 </>

The Blue Gate is a map located higher up in the mountains featuring open areas, small towns, tunnels, and underground complexes. This map unlocks after 18 rounds. </>
Codex </>
The Tubes network has only recently been expanded to reach gates, requiring the construction of all-new Raider structures to facilitate Raider presence. </>
Maps </>
Underground </>

title: Bombardier
text:
</>
 </>
 </>
Bombardier </>
 </>
Threat Level </>
Critical </>
 </>
Armor </>
None </>
 </>
Primary Attack </>
Mortar Fire </>
 </>
Abilities </>
Shockwave </>
 </>
Weakness </>
Rear Plate Leg Joints </>
 </>
Stats </>
 </>
Health </>
2670 [ 1 ] </>
The Bombardier is a large, unarmored ARC machine capable of attacking Raider positions with a powerful, long-range mortar. It's often accompanied by a pair of small, flying drones called Spotters that feed real-time position data to the Bombardier for more accurate strikes. </>
Attack </>
Fires mortar rounds at the target until they perish or get cover. Uses Spotters to pinpoint exactly where a Raider is. </>
Will adjust the round's path to hit where a target is moving to or to thread in between window slits for precision kills. </>
Similar to the Leaper , the Bombardier uses close-range shockwaves to attack at close range. </>
Combat Tips </>
Bombardiers have yellow kneecaps on all leg joints and a yellow cylinder on their rear that deal direct damage. Shooting the kneecaps impairs its mobility and exposes unarmored inner sections for increased damage. Destroying the rear cylinder can disable the Bombardier quickly. </>
The Bombardier is accompanied by Spotter that mark your position for precise mortar targeting, eliminate these first to make it disoriented. The Bombardier becomes vulnerable immediately after firing its artillery, creating a good time to attack. Both Spotter drones will respawn after being destroyed. It is also good to note that one well-placed Deadline near its canister will destroy it in one mine. </>
Loot </>
The Bombardier Cell is a unique item dropped by the Bombardier that's used to upgrade the Refiner . </>
Locations </>
Bombardiers can be found in the following maps and locations (Based on Raider testimonies; need to be verified) : </>
Dam Battlegrounds Water Treatment Control Elevator ( Night Raid ) Primary Facility ( Night Raid ) </>
Water Treatment Control Elevator ( Night Raid ) </>
Primary Facility ( Night Raid ) </>
Buried City On the Roof of the Parking Garage Marano Park North of Plaza Rosa </>
On the Roof of the Parking Garage </>
Marano Park </>
North of Plaza Rosa </>
Spaceport East of Vehicle Maintenance The Trench </>
East of Vehicle Maintenance </>
The Trench </>
The Blue Gate Raider's Refuge Checkpoint Traffic Tunnel </>
Raider's Refuge </>
Checkpoint </>
Traffic Tunnel </>
Codex Entry </>
The Bombardier is an imposing slugger, seemingly sharing a strong kinship with the Bastion, albeit with a distinct signature mayhem. It will try to flush Raiders out of cover with heavy mortar fire. </>
Several theories exist as to how and why ARC deploys its Bombardiers, though all agree that it is a lethal piece of machinery that has sent countless Raiders to the infirmary. </>
The Bombardier is especially dangerous when cooperating with Spotters , allowing it to shoot at Raiders hiding in cover. The Bombardier is equipped with strong front-facing armor, though it is not as impenetrable as the Bastion's . </>
References </>
↑ Health value is currently an estimate, not based on a reliable source. </>

title: Broken Monument
text:
</>
 </>
Broken Monument </>
 </>
Trader </>
Tian Wen </>
 </>
Location </>
Dam Battlegrounds </>
 </>
Related Quests </>
 </>

What We Left Behind </>
 </>

Broken Monument is a quest given by Tian Wen . </>
Objectives </>
In One Round </>
Reach the hallowed grounds by the Scrap Yard </>
Search for a compass near the broken-down vehicles </>
Search for the video tape near the cylindrical containers </>
Search for the old field rations in the Raider camp </>
Deliver the First Wave Tape to Tian Wen </>
Deliver First Wave Compass to Tian Wen </>
Deliver First Wave Rations to Tian Wen </>
Rewards </>
1x Arpeggio I </>
1x Compensator II </>
80x Medium Ammo </>
Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
I have another special site I need you to search for me. An old battlegrounds, from the First Wave. Raiders nowadays usually pick places like that clean, despite the significance they once held. People forget quickly. Quicker than they should. </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
If it looks like it mattered to someone, grab it. Don't break it. This isn't salvage. </>
Idle: </>
About the site... I can't expect you to actually care. But try to be respectful, at least. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
Tian Wen here. Remember, you're looking for a First Wave battleground. There might be junk around, but look for anything that stands out. </>
Upon Completion: </>
I have to admit I didn't expect much to be left. Maybe people missed these, or maybe they didn't care. It's not what I'm looking for, but I appreciate it. I'll make sure they're looked after properly. </>

Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
Our library selection has grown pretty stale. Could you head out to Buried City, and find something more for us to read? Make sure you bring something for everyone. </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
There's an old library back in Buried City. Most books have probably turned to dust by now, but I'm sure you can find some good ones. </>
Idle: </>
There's only so long we can read the same few books. Sure, we have the archives, but that's not really the same thing. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
Apollo speaking. Don't forget to head to the library, Raider; I've been dying to read a new detective novel! I've read the previous one eight times now, and the butler did it every time. </>
Upon Completion: </>
Fantastic, I've got some shelves waiting for them! And hey, looks like there's a magazine tucked into one of the books, too! Might be worth a read. </>

text:
</>

Buried City </>

Amidst the sand dunes in this arid wasteland, Buried City is a remnant of the old world quite unlike the cold steel spires of the Exodus age. Walk these narrow streets and empty plazas, and know that people once lived here. </>

Buried City is a map set in a pre- Collapse city now covered in sand dunes. This map unlocks after playing 6 rounds. </>
Codex </>
Long covered in sand dunes, Buried City offers rare insights in life before the Collapse. Strong winds have now uncovered part of its remains, though the ever-shifting dunes can be treacherous and unstable. </>
Signs around the city reveal that it was originally called Marano by its inhabitants, though that name has long since faded into obscurity. </>

Guide </>
South Journal Map Location </>
Celeste Journal Swamp Location </>
North Journal Map Location </>
Celeste Journal North Location </>
Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
Okay, so this is awkward... I lost two of my journals during some outpost inspections last time I went topside. Could you head out there and try to find them back before someone else stumbles on them? </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
They should be in an outpost out on the Dam; at least I hope so. Bring both back, and we'll pretend I never lost them. </>
Idle: </>
Don't ask me how I lost them—I set them down, got distracted, and only realised I didn't have them anymore when I got back here. People always tell me I shouldn't bring my journals topside, but that's where all the best ideas and musings happen. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
This is Celeste: Look for an outpost near the south part of the swamp. That's where I last remember having the journals. Please don't read 'em, though. Some... sensitive stuff in there. </>
Upon Completion: </>
Oh, thanks goodness; you found them. You just saved me a whole heap of embarrassment. Let's never speak of this again, yeah? </>

title: Celeste
text:
A charismatic Raider leader in Speranza , Celeste is the ubiquitous symbol of hope for humanity in the underground. As the leader of the Raiders, she is responsible for keeping morale up, even as the ARC attacks worsen, and when tragedy comes to pass. While she tries to keep the pressure off, you can find her staying up strategizing into the wee hours of the night, furiously playing darts by the bar, and drinking coffee all day to keep her eyes open. [ 1 ] </>
Celeste lost her home multiple times to ARC attacks during her childhood. The tragedy of losing her father left her deeply scared, but she adapted quickly to survive, developing skills to create and manage what she needed. This survival instinct eventually led to the founding of Speranza, humanity's final stronghold underground. To Celeste, Speranza isn't just a settlement, it's a living entity she cultivated with her own two hands. She has dedicated herself to the city's survival, constantly preparing for the future. But with the growing ARC threat, she senses Speranza won't remain safe forever. She's preparing an evacuation plan in case of an emergency. As a Raider, can you help Celeste protect Speranza's future? [ 2 ] </>
A survivor of The First Wave , Celeste now tries to keep Speranza running smoothly. It's an entirely different challenge. </>
Celeste is the only Trader who accepts Assorted Seeds rather than coins as payment. </>
Shop </>
Quests </>
Check out the Quests overview page for more information. </>
References </>
↑ https://arcraiders.com/news/meet-the-traders-blog </>
↑ https://arcraiders.nexon.com/en-US/world </>

title: Cold Storage
text:
</>
 </>
Cold Storage </>
 </>
Trader </>
Shani </>
 </>
Location </>
Stella Montis </>
 </>
Related Quests </>
 </>
Previous </>
In My Image </>
 </>
Next </>
Snap And Salvage </>
Cold Storage is a Quest given by Shani after completing In My Image . </>
Objectives </>
In One Round </>
Search any J Kozma Ventures container </>
Deliver the Rare Books to Shani </>
Rewards </>
3x Gas Mine </>
1x Raider Hatch Key </>
Dialog </>
Introduction: </>
Reports about Stella Montis keep coming in, and it's unlike anything we've seen before. There may be records or relics from the past in there, and if so, I want them. </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
One of the returning Raiders mentioned breaking open an odd looking container and finding books inside. That sounds like a good place to start. </>
Idle: </>
Oh, and be careful whenever you head into Stella Montis. We still don't know what to expect in there. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
Shani here. You're looking for shipping containers labeled 'J Kozma': that's all the help I can offer. </>
Awaiting Completion: </>
The thought of all that potential knowledge being left up in Stella Montis makes me jittery. </>
Upon Completion: </>
You were thorough. Excellent. I'll look through what you found and make sure to document it in our archives. </>
Guide </>
There are many locations for the containers. This one is in a relatively low traffic area with easy access to the wind tunnel extract. You need to be on the 2nd floor in order to drop down to access it. </>
Location of the loading bay container </>
Search the container </>

The Combat Mk. 2 is a Rare Combat Augment and the direct upgrade to the Combat Mk. 1 , with more backpack slots and higher weight capacity. It introduces Heavy Shield compatability, a unique passive, and one dedicated grenade slot. </>
Compared to the other Rare (Mk. 2) Augments, it has a moderate weight capacity and amount of backpack slots, can support more shield types, and weighs the heaviest at three weight units (one more than Looting and Tactical Mk. 2). </>

Objectives </>
In One Round </>

Antenna terminal location [ guide 1 ] </>

Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
We've been losing signals in some areas of Buried City - my guess is that our equipment is acting up. You're quite skilled with repairs, aren't you? Could you check it out? </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
The signal issues seem to stem from the Red Tower in Old Town, so I'd check out the equipment over there first. </>
Idle: </>
Don't forget to check in on the radio equipment the next time you stop by Buried City. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
Shani speaking. The Red Tower Hideout is in the Old Town. I'll let you guess the color. See if you can figure out what's wrong with the radio equipment. </>
Upon Completion: </>
"Communication Hideout" video plays. </>
↑ After the the Generator activation turn around, through the window, up the stairs, turn right to climb the ladder, then around the corner. </>

title: Dam Battlegrounds
text:
</>
 </>
Dam Battlegrounds </>
 </>
The Alcantara Power Plant, or The Dam, stands a silent sentinel amidst waterlogged lands. Once a rare lifeline for settlers during the age of Sunrise, it became a shell-scarred battleground during the closing battles of the First Wave. </>
 </>
Difficulty </>
 </>
Normal Variant </>
2/5 </>
 </>
Uncovered Caches </>
2/5 </>
 </>
Prospecting Probes </>
3/5 </>
 </>
Harvester </>
3/5 </>
 </>
Husk Graveyard </>
3/5 </>
 </>
Electromagnetic Storm </>
4/5 </>
 </>
Night Raid </>
4/5 </>
 </>
Cold Snap </>
4/5 </>
Dam Battlegrounds is the first map that Raiders will encounter. It features swamps, forests, and a range of structures. </>
Codex </>
Even now, these toxic, waterlogged lands remain a hot spot for ARC skirmishes. Filled with research buildings, various Dam structures, and the ramshackle hydroponic domes, Raiders know it to be a reliable source of valuable loot. </>
During the First Wave , the Alcantara Dam was the site for many of the conflict's most harrowing battles, with scars and structures still pockmarking area today. </>
Maps </>

title: Deciphering The Data
text:
</>
 </>
Deciphering The Data </>
 </>
Trader </>
Shani </>
 </>
Location </>
Spaceport </>
 </>
Related Quests </>
 </>
Previous </>
Paving The Way </>
 </>
Next </>
Groundbreaking </>
Deciphering The Data is a quest given by Shani . </>
Objectives </>
Use the Magnetic Decryptor in the Fuel Control Building </>
Reach the Arrival Building in Spaceport </>
Use the Magnetic Decryptor on the top floor of the Arrival Building </>
Rewards </>
3x Defibrillator </>
3x Trailblazer </>
Guide </>
first location: Fuel Control building (south-west facing entrance) </>
Enter through this door with "Fuel Control - Authorised Personnel Only" written next to it </>
at the end of the room, find the terminal with an interact prompt to "decrypt data" </>
second location: Arrival Building, top floor </>
amongst the offices on the top floor, find the stack of terminals and interact with the second to last one on the right to finish the quest </>
Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
If the data you found can keep the ceiling from collapsing, we have no time to spare. </>
I know of a few magnetic decryptors around Acerra Spaceport, from back during the Exodus. They might still be working. </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
There's a decryptor in the Fuel Control Building by Acerra Spaceport. See if it can read that data. </>
Idle: </>
Still here? Go decipher that data before some sinkhole invites a Bastion inside. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
This is Shani. There's a magnetic decryptor in the Fuel Control Building. If it's still working, it may be able to decipher that research on earthquake-resistant housing. </>
Upon Completing First Objective: </>
No luck, huh? Try heading to the Arrival Building instead; they have a different model decryptor there. </>
Upon Completion: </>
Looks like the data's been fully destroyed. We'll have to figure out a different way to learn about their research. </>

title: Digging Up Dirt
text:
</>
 </>
Digging Up Dirt </>
 </>
Trader </>
Celeste </>
 </>
Location </>
Buried City </>
 </>
Related Quests </>
 </>
Previous </>
Tribute To Toledo </>
 </>
Next </>
Turnabout Building A Library </>
Digging Up Dirt is a Quest given by Celeste after completing Tribute To Toledo . </>
Objectives </>
Locate the Santa Maria Houses in Old Town. </>
Locate the Dead Drop inside the courtyard. </>
Rewards </>
2x Advanced Electrical Components </>
2x Speaker Component </>
Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
We caught a break. One of our scouts saw a member of the Tubes Management make a dead drop inside the Santa Maria Houses in the Buried City. This might be our chance to dig up some dirt on them for a change. You in? </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
Perfect. My scout couldn't get too close without risking discovery, so all we know is it's somewhere inside the Santa Maria Houses in the Buried City. Go there and see what you can dig up. </>
Idle: </>
The only thing official about the OTTM is how they slapped 'official' on their name and hoped no one would question it. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
This is Celeste speaking: The alley behind the houses should be the quickest way to get inside. There's a sort of indoor courtyard there that would be the likeliest place to hide something in plain sight. </>
Awaiting Completion: </>
Here to make my day better, Raider? </>
Upon Completion: </>
So, the OTTM had a mole problem, and they're a lot smaller and a lot weaker than they present themselves. </>

</>

 </>

 </>

Doctor's Orders is a quest given by Lance . </>
Objectives </>
Obtain 1 Syringe </>
Obtain 2 Antiseptic </>
Obtain 1 Durable Cloth </>
Obtain 1 Great Mullein </>
Rewards </>
3× Adrenaline Shot </>
3× Sterilized Bandage </>
1× Surge Shield Recharger </>
Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
Say, newbie: if you want me to treat you, you better prove that those precious limbs of yours are worth bandaging. </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
Show me you can grab some medical supplies next time you're topside, and I'll think about whether you're worthy of my talents. </>
Idle: </>
Always keep some bandages on your person, in case you get hit. Regular works well, sterilized ones even better. In a pinch, any piece of fabric you can get your hands on will do the trick. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
This is Lance: Hey, friend-o, picked up your frequency. Anyway, see to those medical supplies, and do try to come back in one piece — it makes my life a lot easier. Lance, out! </>
Upon Completion: </>
You survived! Not that I thought you wouldn't, of course. All right, then — how about some proper bandages instead of those dity rags? </>

title: Dormant Barons
text:
</>
 </>
Dormant Barons </>
 </>
Trader </>
Shani </>
 </>
Location </>
Dam Battlegrounds Spaceport The Blue Gate </>
 </>
Related Quests </>
 </>
Previous </>
Greasing Her Palms The Trifecta </>
 </>
Next </>
Mixed Signals What We Left Behind </>
Dormant Barons is a quest given by Shani . </>
Objectives </>
Loot a Baron Husk </>
Rewards </>
3x Door Blocker </>
3x Li'l Smoke Grenade </>
Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
During the First Wave the Barons did more damage than all the other machines combined. Now they're mere husks; fixed in place where they once fell... </>
Still, their internals might hold the answer to keeping ARC at bay. So open one up, and bring me whatever is inside. </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
Great. There's a baron husk by the Spaceport walls, and one in the swamp by the Dam. </>
Idle: </>
The way they used to make the ground tremble when they walked... I'll never forget it. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
This is Shani. Be on your guard, Raider: even a baron's decayed husk can still hurt you. </>
Upon Completion: </>
If there's still life in the Barons after all these years, these parts must contain a wealth of valuable data. I'll get them analyzed; see what we can find. </>

title: Echoes Of Victory Ridge
text:
</>
 </>
Echoes Of Victory Ridge </>
 </>
Trader </>
Celeste </>
 </>
Location </>
Dam Battlegrounds </>
 </>
Related Quests </>
 </>
Previous </>
Keeping The Memory </>
 </>

Unexpected Initiative </>
Echoes Of Victory Ridge is a quest given by Celeste . </>
Objectives </>
In One Round </>
Reach Victory Ridge </>
Retrieve the battle plans from the hideout under the broken highway </>
Deliver Major Aiva's Patch to Celeste </>
Guide </>
Echos of Victory Location </>
Location under bridge </>
Rewards </>
6x Crude Explosives </>
2x Processor </>
1x Music Box </>
Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
Did you feel any tremors last night? Me neither. But apparently the ground shifted at some point, and in the process it unearthed an old First Wave outpost that'd been blocked by debris. I'd like you to get in there quick, before anyone else does. </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
Good. It's out on the Dam, by the old ridge. Head straight there, if you can. Bring back anything significant, but if you see any battle plans, those would be invaluable. </>
Idle: </>
Did you check out the old outpost yet? I'd rather get it done quickly, before others start picking it clean. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
This is Celeste speaking: I'll be honest, Raider; we called it an outpost, but it was more of a hideout, really. See if the tremors revealed any of our old battle plans. We need to learn from the past now more than ever. </>
Upon Completion: </>
"Echoes of Victory Ridge" video plays. </>

Research and Administration lobby and cafeteria. </>

A trattoria building with scaffolding, a sign outside says "Il Maiale Dorato". Just south of the highway. </>
Guide </>
Map location of the Espresso Machine </>
Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
A Raider came into my shop earlier, to trade some grenades for a machine she found in Buried City. She said it makes coffee, but it seems to be missing a few parts. Up for a job? </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
There should be plenty of cafes in the Buried City where you can search for the parts. </>
Idle: </>
There should be several cafes in both Old Town and the City Center of Buried City. I think they called them trattorias. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
This is Apollo. Take a look around the old town, if you can. Should be plenty of charming trattorias with espresso machines you can... Let's say; borrow from. </>
Upon Completion: </>
Thank you! Once I figure out how to brew a cup of espresso, you'll be the first to know. </>

title: Expedition
text:
</>
 </>
Expedition </>
 </>
Type </>
Recurring </>
 </>
Duration </>
64 days </>
 </>
Start </>
22 December, 2025 </>
 </>
End </>
24 February, 2026 </>
 </>
Construct a caravan to send your raider off on an Expedition beyond the rust belt. </>
 </>
Expeditions are perilous. Your Raider will carry all their possessions into the unknown beyond the Rust Belt. In return, your next Raider gains a unique edge that lasts until the next Expedition departs. </>
Undertaking an Expedition means your Raider leaves the Rust Belt for good. Preparing your caravan takes time and resources, and once it departs, much of your progress will be reset. Some rewards and advantages carry over to your next Raider, lasting until the next Expedition begins. These advantages can be increased by continuing to send Raiders on future Expeditions. </>
Expedition is a recurring Project unlocked at level 20. At the end of the project, players can trade most of their account's progress in exchange for both temporary and permanent rewards. </>
The Current takes place from 22 December, 2025 to 18 February 2026. The departure window is from 17 February to 24 February. </>
Overview </>
Players will have 60 days to complete all 6 stages of the project, where various resources are committed and cannot be retrieved. Once all stages are complete and the departure window is open, players will have a 7-day window to depart with their caravan. </>
 </>
This will be reset </>
This will be kept </>

Rewards and buffs </>
Completing an Expedition gives permanent unlocks and temporary advantages for your new Raider lasting advantages until the next Expedition departs. </>
Permanent rewards will persist regardless of if the Expedition project is completed again. </>
Temporary buffs can stack up to a maximum of three times for each consecutive completion of expeditions, but are lost as soon as one expedition is not completed. </>
 </>

 </>
Skill points (depending on stash value): 1 Skill point for each 1,000,000 of stash value (items & coin are added), up to a maximum of 5,000,000 (5 Skill Points) </>
1 Skill point for each 1,000,000 of stash value (items & coin are added), up to a maximum of 5,000,000 (5 Skill Points) </>
 </>
+12 Stash space </>
Current </>
The current Expedition takes place from 22 December, 2025 to 18 February 2026. The departure window is from 17 February to 24 February. </>
The following are the stage requirements for the current Expedition. </>
Building the base structure and frame of the caravan </>
The following items must be committed to progress to the next stage, and cannot be retrieved. </>
150x Metal Parts </>
200x Plastic Parts </>
80x ARC Alloy </>
15x Steel Spring </>
Connecting wiring, ventilation, and essential power systems </>
The following items must be committed to progress to the next stage, and cannot be retrieved. </>
35x Durable Cloth </>
25x Wires </>
20x Electrical Components </>
4x Cooling Coil </>
Building walls and roof, installing, core systems, and defining the interior layout </>
The following items must be committed to progress to the next stage, and cannot be retrieved. </>
4x Light Bulb </>
30x Battery </>
10x Shredder Gyro </>
1x Exodus Modules </>
Adding storage, workbenches, utilities, and personal touches </>
The following items must be committed to progress to the next stage, and cannot be retrieved. </>
5x Frequency Modulation Box </>
5x Advanced Electrical Components </>
3x Ion Sputter </>
3x Leaper Pulse Unit </>
Loading the caravan with vital supplies. Combat gear, survival equipment, provisions, and repair materials are needed to fully prepare for the Expedition. </>
The following types of items must be committed to progress to the next stage, and cannot be retrieved. </>
250,000 Coin worth of Combat Items Ammo , Grenades , Traps , Weapons , Weapon Modifications </>
Ammo , Grenades , Traps , Weapons , Weapon Modifications </>
100,000 Coin worth of Survival Items Shields , Gadgets , Utilities , Augments , Regenerative </>
Shields , Gadgets , Utilities , Augments , Regenerative </>
180,000 Coin worth of Provisions Nature , Miscellaneous , Trinkets , Old World , Keys </>
Nature , Miscellaneous , Trinkets , Old World , Keys </>
300,000 Coin worth of Materials </>
Your caravan is stocked with necessities and ready to depart on your Expedition. Once the departure window opens, you can choose to send your Raider beyond the borders of the Rust Belt forever. All items remaining in your Raider's stash will be contributed to the Expedition, and your next Raider can earn up to five skill points based on on the total value of those items. </>

title: Extraction Points
text:
Extraction Points are locations that enable a return to Speranza from Topside . Every extraction point has a shutdown time except Raider Hatches which can be found on all maps. </>
Dam Battlegrounds and Spaceport use cargo elevators </>
Buried City uses metro stations </>
The Blue Gate uses airshafts </>
Stella Montis uses metro stations and airshafts </>
Tips </>
Any raider inside of an Extraction Point will safely return to Speranza, even if DBNO (Down But Not Out). </>
Raiders can still interact with the Extraction Point button and terminal when DBNO. </>
It is possible to survive the impact of the last ARC Orbiter as long as the Extraction Point button has been pressed before its shutdown time. </>

title: Eyes In The Sky
text:
</>
 </>
Eyes In The Sky </>
 </>
Trader </>
Shani </>
 </>
Location </>
Dam Battlegrounds Buried City Spaceport </>
 </>
Related Quests </>
 </>
Previous </>
A Lay Of The Land </>
 </>

After Rain Comes A Balanced Harvest Back On Top </>
Eyes In The Sky is a Quest given by Shani after completing A Lay Of The Land . </>
Objectives </>
On Dam Battlegrounds , install a LiDAR Scanner at the top of the Control Tower. </>
On Spaceport , install a LiDAR Scanner at the Communications Tower </>
On Buried City , install a LiDAR Scanner on top of the Galleria sign (zipline required) </>
Granted Items </>
1× Zipline </>
Rewards </>
3× Tagging Grenade </>
1× Vita Spray </>
5× Yellow Light Stick </>
Guide </>
Dam Map </>
Dam Location </>
Spaceport Map </>
Spaceport Location </>
Buried Map </>
Buried Location (zipline required) </>
Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
Those LiDAR scanners you found work best when put in high locations. I've identified a few good spots around the Rust Belt; hope you're surefooted. </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
You'll need to put the scanners pretty high up, so you may want to bring a zipline or two. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
This is Shani. Hope you hear me alright. I've identified the places most likely to give us a clean signal. Place the LiDAR scanners there, and don't fall down, Raider. </>
Upon Completion: </>
Great work, Raider! Now we won't just have to rely on our ears to monitor those tremors. </>

title: Eyes On The Prize
text:
</>
 </>
Eyes On The Prize </>
 </>
Trader </>
Tian Wen </>
 </>
Location </>
Buried City </>
 </>
Related Quests </>
 </>
Previous </>
Market Correction </>
 </>
Next </>
Industrial Espionage </>
Eyes On The Prize is a quest given by Tian Wen . </>
Objectives </>
Find the secluded roof terrace south-west of the Southern Station, look for blue tarps. </>
Rewire the solar panel using 3 Wires </>
Rewards </>
1x Extended Shotgun Mag II </>
1x Extended Medium Mag II </>
Guide </>
Eyes on the prize map </>
Eyes on the prize </>
Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
Everything's been calm around my drop-offs since you helped out, but that doesn't mean it'll stay that way for long. I've set up surveillance at one of my most used spots in Buried City, to prevent future tampering. Only problem is, it needs power to go live. </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
There's a secluded solar panel near the Southern Station in Buried City. Go there, rewire the junction, and tie it into my setup. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
Tian Wen here. You'll find the solar panel by a nice secluded roof terrace, near the Southern Station. Look for blue tarps. Rewire it so my surveillance gets priority. The rest of the grid can go dark, for all I care. </>
Upon Completion: </>
Nice. With this surveillance, I can keep an eye on my stashes. Thanks for helping out. </>

title: Field Depot
text:
The Field Depot is a structure in Arc Raiders, serving multiple purposes. Several Field Depots are scattered across each map , with fixed locations. </>
These structures are easily recognizable by the large antenna and satellite dish on their roof, as well as their weathered, rusty exterior. </>
ARC Field Crates </>
Field Crates are carriable two-handed boxes that can be found in the vicinity of the depot. They slow you down and prevent you from using any gear until dropped. They can be carried inside and exchanged for a reward. </>
See Field Depot Pneumatic Delivery System for the loot pool for delivering an ARC Field Crate. </>
Quests </>
In the quest Off The Radar , the raider has to repair the roof antenna of any field depot. </>
In the quest Down To Earth , the raider has to deliver a field crate to the supply station inside. </>
Other Facts </>
Referred as "Field Station" in Feats </>
Pictures </>
A Field Crate found in Research on Buried City </>

title: Fireball
text:
</>
 </>
 </>
Fireball </>
 </>
Shani: They'll give you a good scorching, if you let them get close enough. </>
 </>
Threat Level </>
Moderate </>
 </>
Armor </>
Heavy </>
 </>
Primary Attack </>
Flamethrower </>
 </>
Abilities </>
None </>
 </>
Weakness </>
Core </>
 </>
Stats </>
 </>
Health </>
20 [ 1 ] </>
The Fireball is a fast-moving, ball-shaped ARC machine, usually spotted rolling around indoor areas. It spews fire at any perceived threat in its vicinity, roasting anyone not made out of fire-resistant materials. </>
With its speed and flame-throwing capabilities, it can cause great trouble for Raiders; in particular when encountered in groups or alongside Ticks . </>
Attack </>
When in its aggressive state, a Fireball will roll towards its target and open its front panel, unleashing a long burst of flames using its flamethrower. A Fireball's attack deals serious damage if caught in the flames. Once the Raider is on fire, they will continue to receive burning damage that lasts for a few seconds (regardless of if it is done attacking or has been destroyed). </>
Combat Tips </>
Fireballs open their front panel when attacking, exposing their unarmored core. Although the core is weak and can be destroyed by any weapon, the shell that covers it as a Fireball is patrolling is quite strong and requires a Medium Ammo or Heavy Ammo weapon to pierce it. Light Ammo weapons are ineffective against its shell and will bounce off. The easiest ways to deal with a Fireball is either by waiting for its front panel to open and shooting its core or using a hard-hitting weapon like a Ferro or Anvil to pierce its shell. </>
Attacks can be avoided by </>
Shooting the Fireball prior to it attacking </>
Vaulting over edges where the Fireball cannot navigate </>
Creating distance between you and the Fireball </>
Dodge Roll </>
Note: Fireballs coat the nearby surroundings in a blanket of fire once destroyed that will light Raiders on fire. </>
Loot </>
Locations </>
Fireballs can often be found in bunkers or underground; they rarely appear in the open world. If you need to find some, check the entrances to the Metro in Buried City or the large underground bunker in the upper right of Blue Gate. </>
Codex Entry </>
The Fireball is a fast-moving, ball-shaped ARC machine, usually spotted rolling around indoor areas. It spews fire at any perceived threat in its vicinity, roasting anyone not made out of fire-resistant materials. </>
With its speed and flame-throwing capabilities, it can cause great trouble for Raiders ; in particular when encountered in groups or alongside Ticks . </>
To use its flamethrower, the Fireball needs to open up its armor plating, exposing a weak spot that trigger-happy Raiders have been known to exploit. </>
References </>
↑ Health value is currently an estimate, not based on a reliable source. </>

title: Flickering Threat
text:
</>
 </>
Flickering Threat </>
 </>
Trader </>
Celeste </>
 </>
Location </>
Dam Battlegrounds </>
 </>
Related Quests </>
 </>

 </>

Flickering Threat is a Quest given by Celeste after completing Power Out . </>
Objectives </>
Find the Generator Room </>
Repair the Generator Requires 4 Wires </>
Requires 4 Wires </>
Find the Ventilation Shaft It is the tall building to the West of the elevator, accessible via the SE door of the Generator Room </>
It is the tall building to the West of the elevator, accessible via the SE door of the Generator Room </>
Enable the power via the power switch underneath the stairs </>
Rewards </>
Radio Renegade Outfit (Helmet Variant) </>
5x Medium Gun Parts </>
3x Advanced Mechanical Components </>
Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
My usual engineer is still healing from his wounds, and has been loopy for days. We can't afford to be at half-grid until he heals; I need someone to pick up his wrench in the mean time. </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
Watch your back when you're in the Power Generation Complex. I don't want my backup engineer bedridden as well. </>
Idle: </>
We've had to divert power to the most critical sections for now, so some people are going without. We can't keep this up for long. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
This is Celeste. There's a Power Generation Complex by the Dam; the wounded engineer was mumbling about the Generator Room in his sleep. Never stops working, that man. </>
Upon Repairing Generator: </>
Generator works. Now find the power switch in the Ventilation Shaft. Look for a high tower; the switch should be under the stairs. </>
Upon Enabling The Power: </>
Our systems just lit back up, and the engineer's mumbling is getting more coherent by the minute. Thanks, Raider; get home safe. </>
Awaiting Completion: </>
Lance tells me the engineer will be back on his feet in no time. </>
Upon Completion: </>
The power is back at full capacity; that should buy my engineer some time to recover from his wounds. Thank you. </>

title: Grenades
text:
Grenades are throwable devices used to damage Raiders and ARCs or for non-damaging utility purposes (e.g., to create a smoke screen , distract Arcs , or illuminate an area . In a pinch, certain ARC parts or scavenged loot can be thrown and used as makeshift grenades. </>
Grenades </>
 </>
Item </>
Description </>
 </>
Light Impact Grenade </>
A grenade that detonates on impact, dealing explosive damage in a small radius. </>
 </>
Heavy Fuze Grenade </>
A grenade that detonates after a delay, dealing explosive damage in its radius. </>
 </>
Blaze Grenade </>
A grenade that detonates on impact, covering an area in fire that deals damage over time. </>
 </>
Gas Grenade </>
A grenade that creates a lingering toxic cloud on impact, draining the stamina of any Raiders within its area of effect. </>
 </>
Showstopper </>
A grenade that detonates after a delay, stunning enemies within it's radius. </>
 </>
Snap Blast Grenade </>
A grenade that sticks to surfaces, dealing explosive damage after a short delay. </>
 </>
Seeker Grenade </>
A homing grenade that targets a single nearby ARC dealing explosive damage on impact. </>
 </>
Shrapnel Grenade </>
A makeshift fuze grenade that bursts into razor-sharp fragments upon detonation. </>
 </>
Trigger 'Nade </>
A remote-detonated grenade that can stick to surfaces and ARC, dealing explosive damage when triggered. </>
 </>
Trailblazer </>
A grenade that emits a trail of flammable gas along its path, causing an explosive chain reaction when it ignites. </>
 </>
Wolfpack </>
A grenade that scatter into multiple homing missiles, each one targeting ARC and dealing explosive damage on impact. </>
 </>
Lure Grenade </>
A noisy device that sticks to surfaces distracting nearby ARC machines and drawing their fire. </>
 </>
Li'l Smoke Grenade </>
A Grenade that pops into a thick but small smoke cloud on impact, blocking visibility from ARC and other Raiders. </>
 </>
Smoke Grenade </>
A grenade that creates a lingering smoke cloud on impact, blocking visibility from other Raiders. </>
 </>
Tagging Grenade </>
A grenade that detonates after a delay, tagging Raiders and ARC enemies in an area, allowing you to briefly track their location. </>
 </>
Light Stick </>
A throwable chemical light that illuminates the area around it. </>

Groundbreaking is a Quest given by Apollo after completing Deciphering The Data . </>
Introduction </>
Data or no data: we'll learn how to make this place earthquake-proof. With a research this in-depth, there's bound to be a paper trail somewhere. </>

Photograph the abandoned housing project </>
Dialog </>
Introduction: </>
Data or no data: we'll learn how to make this place earthquake-proof. With a research this in-depth, there's bound to be a paper trail somewhere. </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
Pilgrim's Peak seems to have been a major hub for Exodus research. It's by the Blue Gate; take this key and go check it out. </>
Idle: </>
We need to hold on to hope no matter what. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
This is Apollo. Head to Pilgrim's Peak, and see if you can find any paper trail of that research. </>
Upon Completion: </>
Hah, what a breakthrough! I always knew we'd come out of this stronger. </>
Notes </>
↑ This is an optional and hidden objective that can be completed by finding a quest-exclusive container behind the front desk of Pilgrim's Peak, which will drop a Blue Gate Communication Tower Key . </>

title: Workshop
text:
The Workshop lets you craft gear, weapons, items, and consumables. You start with the workbench, a free basic bench which enables you to craft basic weapons and most types of ammo , and Scrappy , the rooster which passively generates basic materials as you explore Topside . </>
Each workshop station requires different materials to build and upgrade (up to level 3) and unlocks more items which can be crafted. Certain items will need to be unlocked by learning their blueprint alongside a specific workbench level to be crafted. </>

Scrappy </>
This rooster has been a resident of the workshop since the day you moved in, and likely long before that. Will periodically bring back dubiously-sourced materials and share them with you. </>
Scrappy brings you Metal Parts , Fabric , Plastic Parts , Chemicals , Rubber Parts , and Assorted Seeds . </>
In the table below, you will see the rewards given to you by Scrappy based on his level, the minimum amount of time you spent in the raid, and if you extracted successfully or not. </>
You will need to spend at least 1 minute in a raid to receive anything. Surrendering 5 seconds in to a raid will not net you anything. </>
Surrendering 5 seconds in to a raid will not net you anything. </>
The maximum amount you receive is anything over 15 minutes in raid. Spending 15 minutes or 40 minutes will net you the same amount of rewards. </>
Spending 15 minutes or 40 minutes will net you the same amount of rewards. </>
The time is the time you spend in the raid and not how long the raid has been going. If you spawn in to a raid at 18 minutes remaining and extract at 11 minutes remaining in the raid, you will gain the resources for being in the raid for >6 minutes, and not >15 minutes. </>
If you spawn in to a raid at 18 minutes remaining and extract at 11 minutes remaining in the raid, you will gain the resources for being in the raid for >6 minutes, and not >15 minutes. </>
Note: Scrappy will hold up to 50x of each item, including Assorted Seeds , even though the UI shows Assorted Seeds as a stack-size of 100. </>
Values in table are base values. If you took the Expedition , your rewards will be almost 6% higher, but it is inconsistent. For around every 30 items you accumulate on Scrappy, you will get 1 extra of each item in your stash after claiming, up to a max of 50 after the expedition bonus. There is some inconsistency that is still being discovered, e.g. 20 or 26 items gives you +1, 48 gives you +2. </>

Blueprints </>
Blueprints are a core component of the Workshop system. They are used to craft specific items such as weapons, materials, and gadgets. </>
Blueprints are most reliably found in the loot containers of locked rooms, but can occasionally be rewards from quests. </>
A blueprint must be extracted before it can be used . Place it in your Safe Pocket to guarantee you'll be able to learn it. Once returned to Speranza, consuming the blueprint will add it to the relevant workshop station. </>
A previously learned blueprint will have a tick in the top-right corner of its icon, becoming easily distinguishable from unlearned ones. </>

title: Harvester
text:
</>
 </>
 </>
Harvester </>
 </>
A mysterious harvesting machine has appeared, heavily guarded by the feared Queen . What kind of riches are to be found within? </>
 </>
Difficulty Changes </>
 </>
Dam Battlegrounds </>
2/5 → 4/5 </>
 </>
Spaceport </>
3/5 → 4/5 </>
 </>
The Blue Gate </>
Still 4/5 </>
Harvester is a map modifier that spawns a Harvester structure that is protected by The Queen at a fixed location on each map. </>
Puzzle </>
You will need to breach the containers along the top of the harvester looking for a total of 3 Fusion Cores. 1 Fusion Core should spawn on the ground in the center. After collecting all 3 Fusion Cores you need to interact with the base of the center and insert all 3 Fusion Cores. </>
After inserting all 3 Fusion Cores 12 pulsating yellow targets will appear around the outside, shoot these to destroy them (health of these are WIP it's around 100~). Once all the targets are destroyed the middle will open up reveal between 1-3 blueprints, they will always be the Equalizer or Jupiter . </>
Harvester State </>
Before the Fusion Cores are inserted </>
The Harvester will periodically eject a capsule skyward, when this is happening the harvester fills with fire. You will receive a warning this about to happen by the door opening and the inside filling with a yellow light. </>
After the Fusion Cores are inserted </>
The Harvester will swap between ejecting a capsule and doing a shock attack. The shock attack does no damage to health but will stun lock Raiders and deplete shields, you'll get a warning for this attack with the same noise and the color shifting to blue as well as electricity pulsating in the center. </>
All shock attacks and capsules will cease after the targets are destroyed. </>
Loot Pool </>
Between 1-3 Blueprints, they will always be the Equalizer or Jupiter </>
ARC Items </>

title: Hidden Bunker
text:
</>
 </>
 </>
Hidden Bunker </>
 </>
Someone has hacked the Outskirts Bunker’s security system. Find the 4 buttons to unlock the doors, and be the first to plunder the treasure within. • Fewer active Return Points • No active Raider Hatches • Activate Rooftop Antennas • Retrieve data from the bunker </>
 </>
Difficulty Changes </>
 </>
Trials Multiplier </>
2X </>
 </>
Spaceport </>
3/5 → 5/5 </>
Hidden Bunker is a map modifier that allows access to a bunker complex on Spaceport west of the Departure Building. </>
Unlock the Bunker </>
To unlock the bunker, four rooftop antenna dishes must be activated. These antenna dishes spawn randomly across different rooftops near the center of the map. Any antennas that are not yet activated can be seen as an icon on the map; zooming the map out fully can make it easier to spot them. </>
One player can activate all antennas, or different players can activate separate antennas. The progress in unlocking the bunker is shared across the lobby. </>
To activate an antenna fully, it must be interacted with twice: </>
Upon first activation, a brief alarm will be sent causing Wasp and Hornet ARC to spawn. Defeat these enemies to continue. </>
Upon second interaction, the antenna is marked complete, and a progress message will be displayed to all players in the lobby. </>
Once all antennas are fully activated, the Hidden Bunker will be revealed. There are multiple entrances to the bunker, but all of them can be found immediately to the west of the Departure Building. </>
Downloading/Retrieving Data </>
Interact with any of the terminals inside the bunker to initiate a download sequence that can be tracked on one of the screens at that terminal. Once started the Raider should stand by the terminal until the download is completed. Leaving the vicinity of the terminal during the download will cancel and lock the terminal. </>
Once the download is complete you can interact with the terminal once again for a limited time to retrieve the data. This can be done once for each of the 8 terminals in the Bunker. </>
Bunker Ball Quest </>
Missing info </>
Additional Notes </>
The raid lasts maximum 40 minutes. The bunker is protected by two Bastions and one Bombardier ; it also has two entrances. </>
History </>
 </>
Patch </>
Changes </>
 </>
1.7.2 </>
Hidden Bunker map condition has been re-enabled. </>
Hidden Bunker map condition has been re-enabled. </>

title: Hornet
text:
</>
 </>
 </>
Hornet </>
 </>
Shani: Their electric shocks are no joke. It takes some firepower to get through their armor. </>
 </>
Threat Level </>
High </>
 </>
Armor </>
Light </>
 </>
Primary Attack </>
Electric Shock </>
 </>
Abilities </>
Stuns </>
 </>
Weakness </>
Rear Thrusters </>
 </>
Stats </>
 </>
Health </>
200 [ 1 ] </>
The Hornet is a small, flying ARC machine that shoots stunning projectiles. </>
Attack </>
The Hornet will aim a red targeting laser before firing a stun round capable of delivering a debilitating shock to Raiders . </>
Combat Tips </>
Destroying two of a Hornet's thrusters may cause it to fall towards the ground. This can instantly destroy the Hornet if it drops from a great height. </>
The Hornet's stun round can easily be dodged with good timing. </>
Aim for its unarmored rear thrusters when possible. </>
Heavy Ammo easily destroys the protective armor on the front thrusters. </>
As always, Lure Grenades are your friend when stuck in a sticky situation. </>
Loot </>
The Hornet Driver is a unique item dropped by the Hornet that's used to upgrade the Gear Bench . </>
Codex Entry </>
The Hornet is a small flying drone, equipped with protective armor on its front side. It sports an electric shock-weapon that stuns and damages its targets. </>
It's thought to be designed as an enhanced patrol unit, working with Wasps to neutralize immediate and potential threats to probing sites and other machines. </>
Like the Wasp, damaging its thrusters inhibits its flying capabilities. However, since the front thrusters are covered in armor, it takes a steady hand and skilled shot to reach them. </>
The Hornet Driver is a useful part of the drone's internals. It's speculated by Apollo to control the machine's behavior, and produce the electric shocks for its weapons. Throwing a Hornet Driver at a foe causes it to immediately discharge, stunning its target. </>
References </>
↑ Health value is currently an estimate, not based on a reliable source. </>

Related Quests </>
 </>

 </>

Industrial Espionage is a quest given by Tian Wen . </>
Objectives </>
Find TianWen's weapon cache near the Gas Station in the Outskirts </>
Deliver the Burletta to the rival weapon cache </>
Plant a bug on the weapon cache </>
Granted </>
1x Burletta I </>
Rewards </>
1x Burletta Blueprint </>
3x Mechanical Components </>
3x Simple Gun Parts </>
Guide </>
Industrial espionage map </>
Industrial espionage </>
Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
With my own stashes secured, I think it might be time to keep a closer eye on the competition so this doesn't happen again. </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
Go deliver a Burletta to a rival's drop-off in Buried City: make them think you're one of their runners. Then, plant a listening device on the cache. </>
Idle: </>
Any Burletta will do. Buy one, craft one, loot one. Just don't be stupid and put your own modified Burletta in there, if you even have one. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
Hey. Tian Wen here, listen up. The weapon cache is near the Gas Station at the Outskirts of the town. </>
Upon Completion: </>
They'll think twice before sniffing around my cashes again once they learn that turnabout is fair play. </>

title: Into The Fray
text:
</>
 </>
Into The Fray </>
 </>
Trader </>
Shani </>
 </>
Location </>
Any </>
 </>
Related Quests </>
 </>
Previous </>
Communication Hideout Water Troubles </>
 </>
Next </>
Paving The Way </>
Into The Fray is a quest given by Shani . </>
Objectives </>
Destroy a Leaper </>
Obtain a Leaper Pulse Unit </>
Rewards </>
Radio Renegade Outfit (Grey Color) </>
Backpack Charm (Burger Boy) </>
1x Vulcano III </>
40x Shotgun Ammo </>
Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
It used to be their world, up there. Nobody to challenge their claim. </>
Yet here we are. More outposts. More intel. More firepower. If I didn't know better, I'd say we've got quite a bit of a fight left in us. </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
It used to be madness, to take on a Leaper head-on. But now? I think we might just have what it takes. </>
Idle: </>
Still nothing? I don't blame you. Think carefully about what you're bringing up with you. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
This is Shani. You'll have to be quick on your feet, Raider, because the Leaper does not take any prisoners. Remember the flags: stand tall, and stand proud. </>
Awaiting Completion: </>
Hey, no rush with the... Wait, you actually did it? </>
Upon Completion </>
"Into The Fray" video plays. </>

Introduction: </>
I just treated one of the first Raiders who visited Stella Montis, and she said that she saw... others. Androids, very much like me. </>
Idle: </>
If there are others like me, do you think they'd know my name...? Would they understand me? </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
Lance here. The Raider who mentioned the androids said the ones she saw were all broken down, but... what if there are intact ones? </>
Awaiting Completion: </>
Have you been to Stella Montis yet? Do you have news? </>
Upon Completion: </>
I see. I'll... need some time to process this data. Thank you, friend. </>

Weapon Info </>
The hardest-hitting weapon in the game. Previously, the highest damage cap was 100 from the Ferro or Anvil, but the Jupiter raises this to 120 . This makes it especially lethal against Light or Medium Shields, often leaving a player with less than 30 HP after a headshot . The Jupiter's very strong ARC Armor Penetration allows it to pierce and ignore ARC armor and shoot straight into the core. A cost-effective and a fast way to destroy bigger ARC such as a Bastion or Bombardier with 10 shots aimed at the core. </>

title: Keeping The Memory
text:
</>

 </>
