Keeping The Memory is a quest given by Celeste . </>
Objectives </>
In One Round </>
Reach the wreckage in the Formicai Hills </>
Search for the missing helmet </>
Return the helmet to the memorial </>
Rewards </>
5x Simple Gun Parts </>
5x Duct Tape </>
5x Magnet </>
Guide </>

Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
I lost my cool a bit when I sent you after that trap. I don't usually lose my temper, but the First Wave... We went through a lot, back then. Lost a lot of people. It's still a bit of a raw wound for me, but I want you to understand. </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
There's an old memorial for the people we lost. I'd like you to drop by, make sure it's still standing. Maybe it'll all make more sense once you've seen it yourself. </>
Idle: </>
I wish we had the resources to teach everyone about what it was like, back then. Why this all matters. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
Celeste speaking: The memorial is in the Formicai Hills, near an old First Wave wreckage. It's makeshift, just like we were, but it's there. Make sure it's still standing. </>
Upon Completion: </>
So you saw it, then. Still standing? Good. Maybe it doesn't look like much, but the First Wave resistance deserves to be remembered. </>
Notes </>
The helmet that marks the memorial appears to be the same as the one from the Velati outfit . </>

title: Lance
text:
Lance is one of the most talented medics Toledo has on offer. An eccentric, bubbly android, Lance is always trying his best to fit in amongst the humans, regularly singing off-pitch at midnight karaoke, shopping for the newest underground fashion trends, or boxing in Speranza ’s fight ring. While amnesia has robbed him of his memories from who he was before he arrived, those trapped memories won’t stay gone forever. [ 1 ] </>
Need health items? The only thing Lance can't cure is the common cold. </>

title: Launch Tower Loot
text:
</>
 </>
 </>
Launch Tower Loot </>
 </>
Someone has locked off the Launch Tower, hiding all their hard-earned loot at the top. ARC seems to have ramped up their defenses in response to the heightened activity. </>
 </>
Difficulty Changes </>
 </>
Spaceport </>
3/5 → 4/5 </>
Launch Tower Loot is a map modifier that increases the amount of loot at the top of Launch Tower on Spaceport . The base of the ziplines to the top of the Launch Tower are locked closed </>
Puzzle </>
Insert a fuel cell into a generator at the base of the ziplines to open the doors to gain access to the Launch Tower loot. </>
These fuel cells can be found around the Launch Towers at one of the six entrances to the tunnels or next to one of the two orb-shaped gas cannisters. </>
*needs footage/verification </>
Loot </>
Teal Lockers spawn at the base of the launch tower that can contain the Industrial Battery needed to open up the doors. </>
*needs to be added/verified </>

title: Leaper
text:
</>
 </>
 </>
Leaper </>
 </>
Shani: Raiders much more experienced than you have tried to take one on, and very few returned in one piece. </>
 </>
Threat Level </>
Critical </>
 </>
Armor </>
Heavy </>
 </>
Primary Attack </>
Leaping </>
 </>
Abilities </>
Shockwave </>
 </>
Weakness </>
Eye Leg Joints </>
 </>
Stats </>
 </>
Health </>
1100 [ 1 ] </>
The Leaper is an agile, four-legged brute, often found stomping around open areas. This ARC is equipped with a powerful shockwave pulse that hits anyone nearby, and can leap at Raiders across astonishing distances. Historically, most Raiders have learned to avoid it altogether. </>
Leapers are commonly found in high-risk areas, guarding valuable objectives or patrolling alongside smaller, quicker enemies, thus creating layered threats that can be hard to deal with. </>
Attack </>
As their name might suggest, the primary way Leapers attack is by quickly leaping at Raiders in an attempt to crush them, dealing heavy damage even if the Leaper did not land directly on top of a Raider. The Leaper is very accurate, and is known to crush Raiders even when they were sprinting away at full speed. </>
Combat Tips </>
Blaze Grenades are a cheap and easy method of dealing with Leapers. Throw one grenade directly onto the Leaper and wait for it to burn out. Once the burn stops, throw another. Afterward, the Leaper can be finished with one or two shots from a Heavy Ammo weapon. </>
Loot </>
The Leaper Pulse Unit is a unique item dropped by the Leaper that's used to upgrade the Utility Station . </>
Locations </>
Leapers can be found in the following maps (Not all locations are listed; based on Raider testimonies): </>
Dam Battlegrounds Southeast of the Hydroponic Dome Complex Water Treatment Control Elevator Red Lakes Balcony </>
Southeast of the Hydroponic Dome Complex </>

Codex Entry </>
The Leaper is an agile, four-legged brute, often found stomping around open areas. It is equipped with a powerful shockwave pulse that hits anyone nearby, and can leap at Raiders across astonishing distances. Historically, most Raiders have learned to avoid it altogether. </>
Leapers are commonly found in high-risk areas, guarding valuable objectives or patrolling alongside smaller, quicker enemies, thus creating layered threats that can be hard to deal with. </>
Trivia </>
During Tech Test 2 the Leaper was known as a Bison. </>
References </>
↑ Health value is currently an estimate; not based on a reliable source. </>
tables_segmented: Shani: Raiders much more experienced than you have tried to take one on, and very few returned in one piece.

text:
</>
 </>

 </>
Trader </>
Lance </>

 </>
Related Quests </>

Life Of A Pharmacist is a Quest given by Lance after completing Espresso . </>
Objectives </>
Find the Arbusto Farmacia by the collapsed highway </>
Document the pharmacist's hobbies </>
Document the pharmacist's family </>
Document the pharmacist's taste </>
Document the pharmacist's skills </>
Rewards </>
1x Defibrillator </>
1x Surge Shield Recharger </>
3x Sterilized Bandage </>
Guide </>
at the pharmacy, enter through the main door, then go upstairs </>
the first item is a picture frame on the wall </>
the second item is the piano </>
the third item is a potted plant </>
the last item is on the table </>
Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
This place could use a makeover, but I don't want it looking like your raggedy Raider Dens. See if you can find out how my fellow medical greats used to live. </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
There's a pharmacist that used to live by the collapsed highway in Buried City. Take my camera, and document anything that could tie this room together. </>
Idle: </>
You wouldn't understand. This is between us sensational medical types. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
Hey listen up; Lance here: The pharmacist lived near the collapsed highway; all I need are some tasteful shots for my mood board. No self-portraits, please! </>
Upon Completion: </>
That wallpaper, with those curtains? What a horrendously daft— Actually, no, it's growing on me. Thanks, sport. </>

title: Locked Gate
text:
</>
 </>
 </>
Locked Gate </>
 </>
A clandestine group has activated the Gate's emergency shutdown protocol. 4 key cards need to be obtained to override it, and uncover whatever they're hiding. Fewer active Return Points No active Raider Hatches Collect Security Codes </>
Fewer active Return Points </>
No active Raider Hatches </>
Collect Security Codes </>
 </>
Difficulty Changes </>
 </>
Trials Multiplier </>
2X </>
 </>
The Blue Gate </>
Still 4/5 </>
Locked Gate is a map modifier for The Blue Gate map. </>
Unlock the Gate </>
To unlock the gate at Checkpoint, Raiders must collect the following 4 security codes from their respective locations: </>
Raider's Refuge Security Code </>
Pilgrim's Peak Security Code </>
Reinforced Reception Security Code </>
Ancient Fort Security Code </>
Each code can be found in any container inside the location, with Raiders also able to extract with codes on them. Once Raiders have collected all 4 codes, they need to enter them at Gate Control Room near the Warehouse Complex. </>
[...] </>
Additional Notes </>
The maximum duration of the raid is 40 minutes. </>
Watch your footing; each Security Code location is surrounded by a large number of buried mines . </>
Pilgrim's Peak is protected by 2 Rocketeers . </>
History </>
 </>
Patch </>
Changes </>
 </>
1.7.0 </>
Locked Gate map condition has been added. </>
Locked Gate map condition has been added. </>

Loot are items that can be collected in the world of ARC Raiders. These items are often needed for tasks such as Crafting recipes, Quests , Workshop Upgrades . </>
You can recycle almost every item for basic materials, but recycling can only be done in Speranza . In-raid, you can instead salvage the item to yield fewer or lower-quality items. </>

title: Looting Mk. 2
text:
</>

22 4 0 0 3 0 2 </>
The Looting Mk. 2 is a Rare Looting Augment and the direct upgrade to the Looting Mk. 1 , with more backpack slots and higher weight capacity. It introduces a unique passive, three dedicated Trinket slots, and an additional Safe Pocket slot (for a total of two). </>
Compared to the other Rare (Mk. 2) Augments, it has the largest weight capacity (5 and 15 more than than the Combat and Tactical Mk. 2) and amount of backpack slots (4 and 5 more than the Combat and Tactical Mk. 2). However, its shield compatability is limited to Light Shield compared to the minimum Medium Shield compatability from the Combat and Tactical Mk. 2 Augments. </>

title: Lost In Transmission
text:
</>
 </>
Lost In Transmission </>
 </>
Trader </>
Shani </>
 </>
Location </>
Spaceport </>
 </>
Related Quests </>
 </>
Previous </>
Our Presence Up There </>
 </>
Next </>
Communication Hideout </>
Lost In Transmission is a quest given by Shani . </>
Objectives </>
In One Round </>
Visit Control Tower A6 </>
Reach the top of Control Tower A6 </>
Establish a connection from the terminal </>
Granted </>
1x Spaceport Control Tower Key </>
Rewards </>
1x Snap Hook </>
Guide </>
Be sure to bring the key given to you from accepting the quest. The Control Tower is a dangerous place, it's recommended to either be first or last to the tower if you want to avoid PVP. </>
Visit Control Tower A6 </>
Use the Spaceport Control Tower Key to reach the top </>
Establish a connection from the terminal </>
Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
I have equipment set up at the Spaceport, to monitor ARC's movements. My connection broke down just now - I need you to head to the Control Towers and help me retrieve my logs. </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
I just need you to establish a brief connection, so I can get to my logs. Here's the key to the room — keep it in a safe place. </>
Idle: </>
If you've lost the key to the room, you might find a new one around the offices at the Spaceport. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
Hey—hold on. There. This is Shani: The equipment in Control Tower A-6 is some of the most advanced I have at my disposal. I can't afford having a gap in my data, especially while ARC clearly has something brewing. </>
Upon Establishing Connection </>
Got the logs, and... There's a lot to unpack here. We'll need some time to go through this: get home safe, Raider. </>
Upon Completion: </>
Those logs were absolutely riddled with outlying data points. They might be faulty readings, of course, but they might... not. </>

title: Maps
text:
Go solo or play in groups of up to three, recover materials from caches all over the map, hunt ARC , and try to make it out through an Extraction Point before another Raider comes for your loot. Dynamic Weather, Time of Day and Events keep it fresh. </>
 </>
Map </>
Description </>
Maximum Time </>
Requirements </>
 </>
Dam Battlegrounds </>
The Alcantara Power Plant, or "The Dam", once served as a crucial Raider stronghold during the bitter closing battles of the First Wave. Even now, these toxic, waterlogged lands remain a hotspot for ARC skirmishes. </>
30 Minutes </>
None </>
 </>
Buried City </>
Amidst the sand dunes in this arid wasteland, Buried City is a remnant of the old world quite unlike the cold steel spires of the Exodus age. Walk these narrow streets and empty plazas, and know that people once lived here. </>
30 Minutes </>
Rounds played: 8 </>
 </>
Spaceport </>
Acerra Spaceport is a majestic testament to humanity's past ambitions. This is where the Exodus shuttles, vessels of hope and desperation, once roared into the heavens, leaving a beleaguered Earth behind. </>
30 Minutes 40 Minutes in Hidden Bunker </>
40 Minutes in Hidden Bunker </>
Rounds played: 12 </>
 </>
The Blue Gate </>
Blue Gate, a location higher up in the mountains featuring open areas, small towns, tunnels, and underground complexes to name a few. </>
30 Minutes 40 Minutes in Locked Gate </>
40 Minutes in Locked Gate </>
Rounds played: 18 </>
 </>
Stella Montis </>
A secluded research facility amidst snow-draped peaks, Stella Montis is said to have been the last bulwark of humanity's preservation. </>
30 Minutes </>
Rounds played: 24 </>
 </>
Practice Range </>
Nestled in a secluded mountain hollow, the echoed gunshots from this practice range seem to confuse ARC's sense of direction, creating a rare pocket of open-air safety. Raiders use this practice range to hone their skills, and catch up on some long-overdue stargazing. </>
2 Hours </>
Rounds played: 4 </>
Special Modifiers </>
Maps have special modified variants that will cycle on a timely basis for each map. Playing these conditions could entail having more loot, more aggressive ARC enemies, or different weather conditions. Major modifiers are marked with the Trials icon such as "Night Raid" or "Electromagnetic Storm" and will award 2X Trials points than normal. </>
 </>
Condition </>
Description </>
 </>
Lush Blooms </>
The weather has been unusually agreeable lately, and vital plants and fruits have been thriving. Get out there and gather your food before it is all gone. </>
 </>
Prospecting Probes </>
ARC seem to have entered a period of extended probing, sending guarded probes down en masse. </>
 </>
Husk Graveyard </>
Something has caused ARC machines to go down on their own in great amounts, leaving husks scattered around the Topside. A better opportunity to gather information and parts has rarely presented itself. </>
 </>
Uncovered Caches </>
Storms have unearthed a number of old Raider Caches, but they are rigged to explode should they be exposed for too long. Hurry up and find them all. </>
 </>
Launch Tower Loot </>
Someone has locked off the Launch Tower, hiding all their hard-earned loot at the top. ARC seems to have ramped up their defenses in response to the heightened activity. </>
 </>
Harvester </>
A mysterious harvesting machine has appeared, heavily guarded by the feared Queen . What kind of riches are to be found within? </>
 </>
Matriarch </>
A Matriarch has been sighted nearby. Her children seem hell-bent on keeping her from harm. </>
 </>
Night Raid </>
Raiders have been finding especially good loot behind locked doors, and keys have been more plentiful. The heightened Raider activity has attracted more ARCs than usual. </>
 </>
Electromagnetic Storm </>
Lighting strikes batter the surface; frying electronics, disrupting ARC machines, and electrocuting unsuspecting Raiders. </>
 </>
Hidden Bunker </>
Someone has hacked the Outskirts Bunker’s security system. Find the 4 buttons to unlock the doors, and be the first to plunder the treasure within. </>
 </>
Locked Gate </>
A clandestine group has activated the Gate's emergency shutdown protocol. 4 key cards need to be obtained to override it, and uncover whatever they're hiding </>
 </>
Cold Snap </>
A cold front has swept in with snowfall, and a considerable drop in temperature. The air might feel crisp and brisk at first, but beware of frostbite. Candleberry bushes are bearing valuable fruit - they are now ripe of the picking. </>

Amidst the sand dunes in this arid wasteland, Buried City is a remnant of the old world quite unlike the cold steel spires of the Exodus age. Walk these narrow streets and empty plazas, and know that people once lived here.

Acerra Spaceport is a majestic testament to humanity's past ambitions. This is where the Exodus shuttles, vessels of hope and desperation, once roared into the heavens, leaving a beleaguered Earth behind.
Blue Gate, a location higher up in the mountains featuring open areas, small towns, tunnels, and underground complexes to name a few.
A secluded research facility amidst snow-draped peaks, Stella Montis is said to have been the last bulwark of humanity's preservation.

Nestled in a secluded mountain hollow, the echoed gunshots from this practice range seem to confuse ARC's sense of direction, creating a rare pocket of open-air safety. Raiders use this practice range to hone their skills, and catch up on some long-overdue stargazing.
The weather has been unusually agreeable lately, and vital plants and fruits have been thriving. Get out there and gather your food before it is all gone.
ARC seem to have entered a period of extended probing, sending guarded probes down en masse.

Something has caused ARC machines to go down on their own in great amounts, leaving husks scattered around the Topside. A better opportunity to gather information and parts has rarely presented itself.
Storms have unearthed a number of old Raider Caches, but they are rigged to explode should they be exposed for too long. Hurry up and find them all.
Someone has locked off the Launch Tower, hiding all their hard-earned loot at the top. ARC seems to have ramped up their defenses in response to the heightened activity.
A mysterious harvesting machine has appeared, heavily guarded by the feared Queen . What kind of riches are to be found within?
A Matriarch has been sighted nearby. Her children seem hell-bent on keeping her from harm.
Raiders have been finding especially good loot behind locked doors, and keys have been more plentiful. The heightened Raider activity has attracted more ARCs than usual.
Lighting strikes batter the surface; frying electronics, disrupting ARC machines, and electrocuting unsuspecting Raiders.
Someone has hacked the Outskirts Bunker’s security system. Find the 4 buttons to unlock the doors, and be the first to plunder the treasure within.

A cold front has swept in with snowfall, and a considerable drop in temperature. The air might feel crisp and brisk at first, but beware of frostbite. Candleberry bushes are bearing valuable fruit - they are now ripe of the picking.

title: Marked For Death
text:
</>
 </>
Marked For Death </>
 </>
Trader </>
Tian Wen </>
 </>
Location </>
Buried City </>
 </>
Related Quests </>
 </>
Previous </>
Broken Monument </>
 </>
Next </>
Market Correction </>
Marked For Death is a quest given by Tian Wen . </>
Objectives </>
Reach the Su Durante Warehouses in the Outskirts in Buried City </>
Search for Tian Wen's cache near the Warehouses </>
Follow the clues </>
Rewards </>
1x Shotgun Choke II </>
1x Angled Grip II </>
Guide </>
The cache is outside of the warehouse on the north side of the building </>
Follow the footsteps, proceed into the shrubs of the dune further to the north-west </>
Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
Someone has been lifting supplies from my drop-off point in Buried City. I've set up a trap, but need someone to check it for me. </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
Good. Stake out the area. Catch them in the act, or track them back to where they're stashing my goods. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
This is Tian-Wen. My drop-off cache is on the outskirts of the city. Look for some warehouses, and you should be able to find it. I've rigged the trap with tracing color, so if it went off then whoever triggered it should've left plenty of marks behind. </>
Upon Completion: </>
Huh. I suppose they won't be stealing from me again, at least. By the way, keep this between us. My drop-offs aren't exactly sanctioned by Celeste. </>

title: Market Correction
text:
</>
 </>
Market Correction </>
 </>
Trader </>
Tian Wen </>
 </>
Location </>
Buried City </>
 </>
Related Quests </>
 </>
Previous </>

 </>

Market Correction is a quest given by Tian Wen . </>
Objectives </>
In One Round </>
Locate the cache near Marano Station </>
Sabotage the cache </>
Rewards </>
1x Silencer II </>
1x Extended Light Mag I </>
1x Compensator I </>
Guide </>
Market correction map </>
where the quest objective is </>
Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
That theft before? Doesn't look like a coincidence anymore. Some of the competition from Toledo is setting up shop where they don't belong. I want their cache sabotaged, preferably before they get too comfortable. </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
Find their cache, and deal with it. Make sure they think twice before trying again. My sources tell me it's somewhere near the station, so start there. </>
Idle: </>
Most Toledo caches are packed with low-grade weapons. Taking some out of circulation is a community service. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
Tian Wen here. You'll find their cache around Marano station, marked with a ribbon. A little sabotage should do the trick. </>
Upon Completion: </>
Good job taking care of their cache. That's one less problem off my plate. </>

title: Matriarch
text:
</>
 </>
 </>
Matriarch </>
 </>
Threat Level </>
Extreme </>
 </>
Armor </>
Heavy </>
 </>

Gas Grenades Flashbangs Energy Shield Summon ARC </>
 </>
Weakness </>
Core Leg Joints </>
 </>
Stats </>
The Matriarch is a colossal ARC machine that makes the Queen look friendly by comparison. It can only be found when its map condition is active. </>
Attack </>
Rockets - The Matriarch fires a number of explosive homing rockets. </>
Gas Mortars - The Matriarch fires a number of gas mortars that explode into stamina-draining gas clouds on impact. </>
Energy Shield - The Matriarch deploys an energy shield that absorbs incoming projectiles and cannot be destroyed but can be passed through by Raiders. </>
Flashbangs - The Matriarch fires a number of flashbangs that explode after a delay, blinding and deafening Raiders. </>
Summons/deploy - The Matriarch can call in/deploy other ARC including Ticks , Fireballs , Wasps , Hornets , Leapers , Bastions , Bombardiers and Rocketeers . </>
Combat Tips </>
High Ground/Cover </>
If her children are unable to protect her the fight becomes trivial, examples of good spots: </>
Spaceport - Control Tower A6 and The Launch towers </>
Dam Battleground - </>
Blue Gate - On top of reinforced reception with deployable barricades </>
Weak Points </>
Don't target the legs, target her faceplates until they break off, then her big red glowing core will be exposed </>
Attack Pattern </>
Only attack that really hurts is her rocket barrage, the rest you can brush off relatively fine </>
When her energy shield comes up hold fire till it falls, or if you fancy your chances, slip inside the shield and take shots at her now-exposed core </>
Loot </>
Main debris Advanced ARC Powercell ARC Alloy ARC Circuitry ARC Flex Rubber ARC Motion Core ARC Performance Steel ARC Synthetic Resin ARC Thermo Lining Magnetic Accelerator Matriarch Reactor </>

Codex Entry </>
The Matriarch makes the Queen look friendly by comparison. This colossal terror dominates the battlefield with punishing barrages that impairs vision, cripples movement and tear Raiders apart. </>
The versatility of the Matriarch is stunning. She is able to surprise even veteran Raiders with her tactical capabilities. </>
The Matriarch's Reactor is one of the most sought after trophies. Few Raiders have managed to bring one back home. </>

title: Medical Merchandise
text:
</>
 </>
Medical Merchandise </>
 </>
Trader </>
Lance </>
 </>
Location </>
Dam Battlegrounds Buried City Spaceport </>
 </>
Related Quests </>
 </>
Previous </>
Doctor's Orders </>
 </>
Next </>
A Reveal In Ruins </>
Medical Merchandise is a quest given by Lance . </>
Objectives </>
On Spaceport , search 2 containers in the Departure Building's exam rooms. </>
Search 3 containers in the Hospital on Buried City . </>
On Dam Battlegrounds , search 2 containers in the Research & Administration building's medical room. </>
Rewards </>
Backpack Charm (Banana) </>
3× Defibrillator </>
3× Vita Shot </>
Guide </>
The exam room on Spaceport is located on the first floor of the building, left to the stairs which come up from the ground floor. </>
The medical room on Dam Battlegrounds is located on the first floor of the building and marked with a white cross on a green background at the door. </>
Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
I've become quite craft at weaving bandages from Fabric, but to my shame, I haven't quite mastered weaving an x-ray machine or a pulse oximiter. </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
Excellent. Scope out these locations, and be on the lookout for medical goodies from the world before. </>
Idle: </>
I'll need intrepid friends like yourself, who can get me the finest medical goods Topside has to offer. Whether you want to hang them on the inside of a trench coat, is your call to make. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
Lance speaking. Or at least, simulating speech: Remember to grab as many goodies as you can from those medical facilities. Just resist the urge to sit on a hoard of syringes, OK? </>
Upon Completion: </>
Made it there and back, huh? That opens up endless possibilities. Just mark those medical areas with a nice big cross on your map, all right? </>

title: Mixed Signals
text:
</>
 </>
Mixed Signals </>
 </>
Trader </>
Shani </>
 </>
Location </>
Any </>
 </>
Related Quests </>
 </>
Previous </>
Dormant Barons </>
 </>
Next </>
- </>
Mixed Signals is a quest given by Shani . </>
Objectives </>
Destroy an ARC Surveyor </>
Obtain 1 Surveyor Vault </>
Granted </>
3x Jolt Mine </>
2x Showstopper </>
Rewards </>
1x Photoelectric Cloak </>
1x Raider Hatch Key </>
Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
Have you spotted any Surveyors; the big round ones? </>
They seem to be transmitting data back into orbit, and I can't help but think it's tied to that signal we picked up. Will you break one open, so we can try to decipher the data? </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
Thanks. Surveyors are particularly skittish, so I'd suggest you find a way to stun them before engaging. </>
Idle: </>
Surveyors are full of rare ARC tech, so we might both come out of this ahead. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
Shani speaking. If you spot one of the Surveyors, try to stun it before you engage. They're said to be full of rare ARC tech, so we might both come out of this ahead. </>
Upon Completion: </>
It's not often I get my hands on Surveyor data, but I'd bet my hat this is tied to that signal we heard before. We'll get to deciphering; thanks, Raider. </>

1–4 Olives spawn on the ground below this type of tree. They can be hard to spot, so look out for the little white circle that appear when you're close to an olive. It is not guaranteed that an olive will spawn below the tree, however, you may be able to interact with the tree, dropping between 1 Olive. Note the interact prompt may not always appear, it is best to do a small loop around the tree. </>
The number of Olives dropped can be influenced by the map modifier/event. </>
The Olive Tree can be identified by its larger size, thick dark green crown and ancient looking trunk. </>

title: Our Presence Up There
text:
</>
 </>
Our Presence Up There </>
 </>
Trader </>
Shani </>
 </>
Location </>
Dam Battlegrounds </>
 </>
Related Quests </>
 </>
Previous </>
Back On Top </>
 </>
Next </>
Lost In Transmission </>
Our Presence Up There is a quest given by Shani . </>
Objectives </>
In One Round </>
Visit the Pattern House in The Dam </>
Find and flip the power switch </>
Complete the antenna installation on the roof </>
Guide </>
Locate & enter Pattern House building, look for switch on 1st floor. Flip the switch, then take the zipline to the roof and complete the antenna installation. </>
Map location for switch </>
Flip switch </>
Repair antenna </>
Rewards </>
1x Buried City Town Hall Key </>
1x Raider Hatch Key </>
3x Jolt Mine </>
Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
ARC may be changing, but we're finally changing with it. Let finish up those outposts and revolutionize the way we track them, flank them, and smash them to bits. </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
This one's in the Pattern House, by the Dam. Get the comms and power working, and I'll do the rest from down here. </>
Idle: </>
The sooner we get the outpost set up, the better. I'm not ready to give up on Topside, and neither should you. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
Shani here. The Pattern House is north of the Dam. You'll recognize it by its... Well, you can guess. </>
Upon Completion: </>
Excellent. I know one outpost may seem like a small step, but every building we claim is proof that we're not giving up on Topside. </>

title: Out Of The Shadows
text:
</>
 </>
Out Of The Shadows </>
 </>

Shani </>

Location </>

Out Of The Shadows is a Quest given by Shani after completing A Symbol Of Unification and Sparks Fly . </>
Objectives </>
Destroy a Rocketeer </>
Obtain a Rocketeer Driver </>

1x Medium Shield </>
1x Combat Mk. 2 </>
Rewards </>
3x Surge Shield Recharger </>
2x Wolfpack </>
Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
Did you see the flags? The time for cowering is over. You've been more than battle-tested, from what I hear; think you can take on a Rocketeer? </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
Rocketeers are no joke. Be quick on your feet, and make sure you keep something between their rockets and your... Well, face. </>
Idle: </>
We're lucky that they seldom seem to come in pairs, if nothing else. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
This is Shani: Make sure you're well prepared before you face a Rocketeer head-on. Find solid cover, and aim quick and true. A single misstep can be curtains call. </>
Upon Completion: </>
I can scarcely believe it, you brought down a Rocketeer! We may stand a chance after all. </>

Objectives </>

List of ENELICA buildings: </>

Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
For an entire sector to collapse like that... No wonder people are scared. We need to reinforce beyond anything we've done before, and we can't do it alone. </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
I need you to scope out the ENELICA buildings around the Rust Belt for any data on earthquake-resistant housing. </>
Idle: </>
I hear Shani sleeps below a reinforced table, these days; if she sleeps at all. We'll need to reinforce this place, and we'll need to do it soon. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
Apollo speaking. Our only lead is that a company called ENELICA may have been researching earthquake-resistant housing. They have a few buildings around the Rust Belt; see what you can find. </>
Upon Completion: </>
We'll need help decrypting this data, if it's going to be any use to us. Shani might know how. </>

text:
</>

5,000 </>
Photoelectric Cloak is a gadget that allows raiders to temporarily conceal themselves from ARC. </>
Sources </>
Scavenging </>
Crafting </>
Gadget Info </>
Once in use, you are only able to walk slowly, and any ARC entity will lose sight of you, even if engaged in active combat. </>
The Photoelectric Cloak utilizes energy that is displayed with a meter bar on screen. This energy gradually recharges once the cloak is no longer in use, even if stowed away. </>
Upon utilization, a small chunk of the energy meter gets instantly used, for this reason it might be a good idea to utilize the cloak for longer periods rather than short intervals of time. </>
While it is possible to equip multiple Photoelectric Cloaks in your Loadout, the energy meter is shared between all cloaks on your person, making it impossible to extend its maximum duration. </>

title: Pop
text:
</>
 </>
 </>
Pop </>
 </>
Threat Level </>
Moderate </>
 </>
Armor </>
None </>
 </>
Primary Attack </>
Explosion </>
 </>
Stats </>
 </>
Health </>
20 [ 1 ] </>
The Pop is a small, unarmored ARC machine that's often observed with the Fireball . </>
Attack </>
When in its aggressive state, the Pop quickly rolls toward nearby Raiders. As it approaches, it emits a beeping sound that increases in frequency the closer it gets to its target. Once close enough, the Pop detonates after a short delay, dealing heavy damage to a Raider's shield and health while destroying itself in the process. </>
Note: The Pop does not explode based on a timer, but rather on its proximity to a target. </>
Combat Tips </>
Due to being unarmored, the Pop can be destroyed quickly with any type of weapon . They can often be heard or seen before becoming a threat, however, be cautious. </>
Pops can sometimes spawn in locked key rooms and sit waiting directly behind the door. When you open the door, they may fly out and explode. </>
Attacks can be avoided by </>
Shooting the Pop before it detonates </>
Vaulting over edges where the Pop cannot navigate </>
Creating distance between you and the Pop </>
Dodge Rolling away as it "pops" </>
Loot </>
The Pop Trigger is a unique item dropped by the Pop that's used to upgrade the Explosives Station . </>
Codex Entry </>
The Pop is a small, unarmored rolling machine; often compared to the Fireball . It's a quick, impulsive enemy that often roams in swarms. </>
Often found indoors, the Pop's purpose is thought to be clearing out rubble and blockages that may inhibit ARC 's operations. </>
The Pop seems to have little regard for its own safety; carrying an explosive charge that "pops" upon impact, scorching any Raider that lets it get too close. </>
References </>
↑ Health value is currently an estimate; not based on a reliable source. </>

title: Power Out
text:
</>
 </>
Power Out </>
 </>
Trader </>
Celeste </>
 </>
Location </>
Spaceport </>
 </>
Related Quests </>
 </>
Previous </>
Prescriptions Of The Past </>
 </>
Next </>
Flickering Threat </>
Power Out is a Quest given by Celeste after completing Prescriptions Of The Past . </>
Objectives </>
In One Round </>
Find the Electrical Substation south of the Spaceport </>
Find any sign of the missing engineer </>
Install the fuse </>
Restore the power </>
Rewards </>
Radio Renegade Outfit (Bag Variant) </>
5x Wires </>
5x Explosive Compound </>
5x Oil </>
Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
This goes beyond bad luck. Something - or someone - has knocked out some of our electrical substations. The engineer I sent out to fix it hasn't returned, so I need all available Raiders to look into it. That includes you. </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
The Electrical Substation is south of the Spaceport. Look for the missing engineer, and see if you can fix the power. </>
Idle: </>
Our solar panels are useless without the substations. The reserve generators have kicked in, but they won't sustain us for long. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
Celeste here. The engineer was headed to the electrical substation south of the Spaceport, near the Security Checkpoint. See what you can find. </>
Upon Completing All Objectives: </>
Primary power is back; so we're at least at half-grid. And one of our operators spotted the injured engineer crawling into one of our hatches. </>
Upon Completion: </>
Thank you, that is a huge load off my mind. The engineer managed to limp back here, injured but alive. They're currently being patched up down in the clinic. </>

title: Practice Range
text:
</>
 </>
Practice Range </>
 </>
Nestled in a secluded mountain hollow, the echoed gunshots from this practice range seem to confuse ARC's sense of direction, creating a rare pocket of open-air safety. Raiders use the Backyard to hone their skills, and catch up on some long-overdue stargazing. </>
 </>
Difficulty </>
 </>
Normal Variant </>
None </>
The Practice Range allows you to test out your weapons and gear within a safe area. </>
It features an area to test Shields on dummies, and some dummy Wasps </>
Any spent ammunition and durability will not carry over once you leave the Practice Range, meaning you can safely test any weapon or gadget from your Loadout without penalty. </>
Likewise, any item, ammunition, weapon acquired in the Practice Range will be removed from your Loadout as you head back to Speranza or close the game. </>
Scattered around the Practice range are bags containing Grenades or Traps , and a Raider Hatch Key . </>

Dialog </>
Description: </>
I've been curious about the medical area in the Spaceport for a while now. Something tells me it's got just what I need to become the undeniable champion of this place. </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
Bring me back anything useful from the Medical Exam Room. Records, medical recipes, stress toys; whatever you feel looks important. </>
Idle: </>
I wonder why a Spaceport would need a medical room... </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
This is Lance calling: Bring me back anything useful from the Medical Exam Room. Records, medical recipes, stress toys; whatever you feel looks important. </>
Upon Completion: </>
What fine reading you've brought me! You're my favourite Raider in Speranza — or, well, top ten at least. </>

title: Quick Use
text:
You have 3 different types of Quick Use items, Healing, Utility and Gadgets. Quick use slots help you to solve and withstand the challenges and scenarios you'll face while Topside, be it from other Raiders or ARC . </>
Utility </>
 </>
Name </>
Image </>
Description </>
 </>
Barricade Kit </>
A deployable cover that can block incoming damage until it breaks. Health: 500 </>
 </>
Door Blocker </>
A locking mechanism that can be placed on large metal doors to limit access. </>
 </>
Fireworks Box </>
A remotely triggered arrangement of dazzling fireworks, sure to put on a show. </>
 </>
Remote Raider Flare </>
A deployable device that when manually triggered, launches a Raider Distress Flare </>
 </>
Zipline </>
A deployable zipline that allows you to quickly move between two locations. </>
Gadget </>
 </>
Name </>
Image </>
Description </>
 </>
Binoculars </>
A basic pair of binoculars with two levels of magnification. </>
 </>
Flame Spray </>
A classic makeshift weapon, sure to leave scorch marks. </>
 </>
Acoustic Guitar </>
A playable acoustic guitar used to attract ARC's attention, and impress other Raiders. </>
 </>
Integrated Binoculars </>
Can be equipped and used like regular binoculars, but cannot be dropped or removed from their slot. </>
 </>
Noisemaker </>
A deployable proximity sensor that sounds an alarm when enemy raiders are detected. </>
 </>
Photoelectric Cloak </>
A gadget that allows the user to conceal themselves from ARC. </>
 </>
Recorder </>
A playable recorder used to attract ARC's attention, and impress other Raiders. </>
 </>
Shaker </>
A rhythmic instrument used to attract ARC's attention, and impress other Raiders. </>
 </>
Snap Hook </>
A gadget that allows the user to scale structures and cover large distances. </>
Grenade </>
 </>
Name </>
Image </>
Description </>
 </>
Light Impact Grenade </>
A grenade that detonates on impact, dealing explosive damage in a small radius. </>
 </>
Heavy Fuze Grenade </>
A grenade that detonates after a delay, dealing explosive damage in its radius. </>
 </>
Blaze Grenade </>
A grenade that detonates on impact, covering an area in fire that deals damage over time. </>
 </>
Gas Grenade </>
A grenade that creates a lingering toxic cloud on impact, draining the stamina of any Raiders within its area of effect. </>
 </>
Showstopper </>
A grenade that detonates after a delay, stunning enemies within its radius. </>
 </>
Snap Blast Grenade </>
A grenade that sticks to surfaces, dealing explosive damage after a short delay. </>
 </>
Seeker Grenade </>
A homing grenade that targets a single nearby ARC dealing explosive damage on impact. </>
 </>
Shrapnel Grenade </>
A makeshift fuze grenade that bursts into razor-sharp fragments upon detonation. </>
 </>
Trigger 'Nade </>
A remote-detonated grenade that can stick to surfaces and ARC, dealing explosive damage when triggered. </>
 </>
Trailblazer </>
A grenade that emits a trail of flammable gas along its path, causing an explosive chain reaction when it ignites. </>
 </>
Wolfpack </>
A grenade that scatter into multiple homing missiles, each one targeting ARC and dealing explosive damage on impact. </>
 </>
Firecracker </>
A device that sparks and pops in a pleasant manner. </>
 </>
Lure Grenade </>
A noisy device that sticks to surfaces distracting nearby ARC machines and drawing their fire. </>
 </>
Li'l Smoke Grenade </>
A Grenade that pops into a thick but small smoke cloud on impact, blocking visibility from ARC and other Raiders. </>
 </>
Smoke Grenade </>
A grenade that creates a lingering smoke cloud on impact, blocking visibility from other Raiders. </>
 </>
Tagging Grenade </>
A grenade that detonates after a delay, tagging Raiders and ARC enemies in an area, allowing you to briefly track their location. </>

title: Raider
text:
Raider is the given name of Speranza residents who dare to go Topside to scavenge for vital loots and supplies while ARC machines threaten the surface. </>
Customization </>
Appearance </>
A raider's physical appearance can be customized in four different categories: </>
Body Type (2 Options) </>
Face (16 Options) </>
Face Style (13 Options, 1 from Raider Decks , 9 for Raider Tokens only) </>
Hair, including hair-specific color choices (14 options, 2 from Raider Decks , 2 for Raider Tokens only) </>
Style </>
Raider style options include: </>
Outfits : combined clothing + headgear with toggleable extra features (unlocked separately) </>
Backpacks </>
Backpack Attachments </>
Backpack Charms </>
Skill Tree </>
See: Skills </>
By gathering XP through exploration and combat, raider levels are gained. These can be spent on skills in the skill tree. </>
Trials </>
See: Trials </>
Trials is a ranking system in which raiders compete for points on a leaderboard to raise their trial rank, unlocking weekly and seasonal rewards. </>
Projects </>
See: Projects </>
Projects are long-term tasks involving large resource costs. Expeditions are a permanently recurring project which resets progress in exchange for additional benefits for a new Raider. </>

title: Decks
text:
The Raider Deck is like a battle pass, where you can spend Cred in order to unlock cosmetic rewards. There are a number of rewards to unlock per page in order to progress to the next page. The number of pages in each Raider Deck may vary. At launch, the Raider Decks will be free, but you can expect a mix of paid and free Raider Decks as new ones are added. </>
*Some Raider Decks will be permanent and others will be available for a limited time. </>

title: Raider Tokens
text:
Raider Tokens are the premium in-game currency that can be acquired through your platform store. You can use them to buy cosmetic items in the Shop, and to buy premium Raider Decks when they become available. At first, you won’t be able to earn Raider Tokens via gameplay, but there may be opportunities to do so down the line. </>
*You can start off with 2400 Raider Tokens at launch by purchasing the Deluxe Preorder Bundle </>
500 tokens in 1 Raider Deck </>
500 tokens in Breaking New Ground Event </>

Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
That collapsed highway worries me; it looks to be recent. Much of Topside may be in ruins but most of it is from ages ago. </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
Head back to the valley by the Blue Gate, and see if you can find out what caused the highway to collapse. </>
Idle: </>
Have you checked out that collapsed highway yet? </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
Shani here. Head to the collapsed highway, and see if you can find any traces of what caused its destruction. </>
Upon Completion: </>
Hold on, you're saying it was downed, but free of bullet holes? And it stripped entire forests? </>

Scavenging </>
Crafting </>

Weapon Info </>
The Renegade packs serious stopping power. When fully upgraded, it shoots fast and has outstanding accuracy. </>
Although the Renegade favors medium- to long-range engagements, it's also no slouch when taking the fight inside. Raiders who're crouching and stationary can bullseye targets down range with accuracy similar to that of the Osprey . Equipping the Renegade with a Silencer II or better deafens every shot enough to make it a great stealth weapon, as well. </>
Reloading is slow; every shell is loaded individually. </>

The Rocketeer is a large, flying ARC machine that often spells doom to any unlucky Raider unable to escape its airborne wrath. It's typically deployed in locations of high-value. </>
Attack </>
Aims 4 yellow lasers that, once lined up, turns red a moment before firing 1–4 missiles. Each missile dealing a significant amount of damage and can down a Raider in as little as two hits. </>
Combat Tips </>
The Rocketeer is a deadly ARC that, when engaged without sufficient cover, will quickly end in your demise. Before fighting, seek shelter in buildings or behind substantial cover. Aim for the thrusters while focusing on two in particular. If you manage to get higher than it or to ride the Rocketeer, you can shoot or stick a grenade to the top of its thrusters, since they don't have any armor. </>
Another way to effectively damage the Rocketeer is shooting off its " eyebrow " preferably with a high ARC Armor Penetration stat, then shooting the weak point on top of it with a high fire rate or low reload time weapon. </>
Landing a few Snap Blast Grenades on top of it can take it out easily as well. </>
Similar to other flying ARC, destroying two of its thrusters will cause it to fall towards the ground. When falling from a high enough height, it can be instantly destroyed by its own momentum. Any flying ARC that is stuck on the ground long enough will burst into flames. </>
It is possible to weaponize a Lure Grenade when fighting a Rocketeer as well as another ARC simultaneously - sticking the grenade to another ARC will cause the Rocketeer to attack and damage that ARC. </>
When the Rocketeer's laser disappears (signaling a full lock-on), do one of the following to dodge its attack: </>
Dodge Roll </>
Get behind cover </>
Use caution, as its rockets still do splash damage, so they can still hit you in some circumstances even if you are behind cover. </>
It may also be nice to note that 1 Showstopper grenade will take this ARC to the ground for a few seconds if you hit a thruster, allowing the Raider to attach mines to it or ride it. Hitting the core will stun it temporarily instead, but it will remain in the sky. </>
If you manage to hide from its field of view, the Red Scanner Behavior Stage will last about 20 seconds before transitioning to the Yellow Scanner Behavior Stage, which lasts about the same amount of time. When it reaches the Blue Scanner Behavior Stage, you can also observe its thrusters recovering from an inclined position to a straight position. </>
Loot </>
The Rocketeer Driver is a unique item dropped by the Rocketeer that's used to upgrade the Explosives Station . </>
Achievement Tips </>
Similar to other flying ARC, it is possible to ride on top of a Rocketeer. This can be done directly with the Snap Hook or careful positioning. Alternatively, stunning the Rocketeer with a Showstopper or Hornet Driver will cause it to fall to the ground, allowing for any Raider to easily climb on. Either way, you can then damage the Rocketeer with any weapon (including melee). Dealing 50 damage to any enemy while on top of a Rocketeer will also grant the Death From Above achievement . Be aware that the Rocketeer will execute a flip to attempt to throw you off if you've been riding for too long. </>
Codex Entry </>
Looming grimly in the skies, the Rocketeer is a large, heavily-armored, long-range artillery machine, dominating open spaces with its powerful missile launchers. It can target Raiders from afar, creating hazardous zones that force Raiders to stay on the move or seek cover. </>
ARC seems to station Rocketeers in key areas; guarding high-threat locations, or just roaming and making life miserable for Raiders. They are able to eliminate fortified human resistance points in otherwise hard-to-reach locations. </>
Like the Wasp and the Hornet , it sports thrusters to stay airborne. While these thrusters are technically weak spots, they are large and take a significant amount of firepower to destroy. </>
Though its devastating blasts have sent many an overly-bold Raider to the clinic, increased firepower and clever tactics have allowed some to take the Rocketeers down. </>
References </>
↑ Health value is currently an estimate; not based on a reliable source. </>

Guide </>
Due to the high density of cars and buses, the Checkpoint and Warehouse zones in The Blue Gate is one of the most consistent places to find gears. However, because of the equally high amount of player traffic and ARC presence, it is advised to have upgraded breaching and items to get out of an area quickly, like Adrenaline, Zip Lines, and Smoke Grenades. </>
A few examples of other areas where Rusted Gears are likely to spawn include: </>
Scrap Yard, Hydroponic Dome/Power Generation Complexes, and Water Treatment Control zones on Dam Battlegrounds </>
Rocket Assembly and Vehicle Maintenance on Spaceport </>
Parking Garage and Warehouse on Buried City </>
There are many areas of every map where Rusted Gears can spawn from, so the key is to check any area with source containers that you can thoroughly. </>
These items are a very rare spawn despite their Rare rating, so it may be a good idea to bring a non-free augment or even no augment at all to have a Safe Pocket to keep the gear in the event of knockout. </>

title: Scrappy
text:
Scrappy, The Rooster, will accumulate Metal Parts , Fabric , Plastic Parts , Chemicals , Rubber Parts , and Assorted Seeds after one minute Topside . The materials gathered will increase with any additional time spent Topside and upon successful extraction. Scrappy does not accumulate material while you are offline or hanging out in Speranza . </>
Levels & Collection Box Rates </>
In the table below, you will see the rewards given to you by Scrappy based on his level, the minimum amount of time you spent in the raid, and if you extracted successfully or not. </>
You will need to spend at least 1 minute in a raid to receive anything. Surrendering 5 seconds in to a raid will not net you anything. </>
Surrendering 5 seconds in to a raid will not net you anything. </>
The maximum amount you receive is anything over 15 minutes in raid. Spending 15 minutes or 40 minutes will net you the same amount of rewards. </>
Spending 15 minutes or 40 minutes will net you the same amount of rewards. </>
The time is the time you spend in the raid and not how long the raid has been going. If you spawn in to a raid at 18 minutes remaining and extract at 11 minutes remaining in the raid, you will gain the resources for being in the raid for >6 minutes, and not >15 minutes. </>
If you spawn in to a raid at 18 minutes remaining and extract at 11 minutes remaining in the raid, you will gain the resources for being in the raid for >6 minutes, and not >15 minutes. </>
Note: Scrappy will hold up to 50x of each item, including Assorted Seeds , even though the UI shows Assorted Seeds as a stack-size of 100. </>
Values in table are base values. If you took the Expedition , your rewards will be almost 6% higher, but it is inconsistent. For around every 30 items you accumulate on Scrappy, you will get 1 extra of each item in your stash after claiming, up to a max of 50 after the expedition bonus. There is some inconsistency that is still being discovered, e.g. 20 or 26 items gives you +1, 48 gives you +2. </>

title: Sentinel
text:
</>
 </>
 </>
Turret </>
 </>
Shani: They're known to pick off Raiders from afar. Make sure you find good cover. </>
 </>
Threat Level </>
High </>
 </>
Armor </>
None </>
 </>
Primary Attack </>
High-Velocity Projectile </>
 </>
Weakness </>
Core </>
 </>
Stats </>
 </>
Health </>
300 [ 1 ] </>
The Sentinel is a medium unarmored turret ARC that sits atop buildings and ledges. It is always found outside and often in high locations overseeing an open area. Sentinels have a small, vulnerable capsule attached to the rear of their swiveling arm. </>
Attack </>
The Sentinel will aim a thick orange laser at the Raider while tracking their movement. After a short time, multiple lasers will converge onto the target, indicating the Sentinel is about to fire. Once the lasers converge onto the target, it will fire a Heavy Ammo round after a short delay, dealing major damage. If the firing lasers converge after the target has left line of sight, it will fire at their last known location. The Sentinel has significant targeting range, don't assume you're safe because you're far away. </>
Combat Tips </>
When fighting a Sentinel, find solid cover. Its reaction time and fire rate is relatively slow and can therefore be shot at faster than it reacts. Aim for the yellow canister on the swivel arm to deal increased damage. </>
Attacks can be avoided by </>
Dodge Roll </>
Sliding </>
Moving behind cover </>
Staying out of sight for extended periods </>
Loot </>
Locations </>
Sentinels can be found in areas with large vantage points, mounted both to ceilings and floors, on the following maps (Not all locations are listed; based on Raider testimonies): </>
Dam Battlegrounds North of the Breach South of the Breach On the South corner of Research & Administration </>
North of the Breach </>
South of the Breach </>
On the South corner of Research & Administration </>
Buried City In the bell tower of Town Hall On the underside of the overpass South of Town Hall </>
In the bell tower of Town Hall </>
On the underside of the overpass South of Town Hall </>
Spaceport On the East corner of the South Trench Tower </>
On the East corner of the South Trench Tower </>
The Blue Gate On the concrete beams spanning the Outer Gates On the underside of the communication tower at Pilgrim's Peak </>
On the concrete beams spanning the Outer Gates </>
On the underside of the communication tower at Pilgrim's Peak </>
Stella Montis In the middle of the ceiling in the Atrium </>
In the middle of the ceiling in the Atrium </>
Codex Entry </>
The Sentinel is a stationary turret found perched in high places, equipped with a laser scanner and high-damage sharp-shooting capabilities. </>
The Sentinel's light plating leaves it relatively exposed, but it can be challenging for Raiders to get close enough for a clean shot. Learning how to approach a Sentinel without going down oneself is a risky endeavor. </>
References </>
↑ Health value is currently an estimate; not based on a reliable source. </>

title: Shani
text:
The eagle-eyed head of security for Speranza , Shani has contingency plans for her contingency plans. She is Speranza’s resident ARC expert, and Celeste ’s biggest resource when it comes to planning successful skirmishes Topside . While most of Speranza’s inhabitants know her to be obsessive, suspicious, and paranoid, Shani doesn’t mind her reputation as long as she’s able to keep her city safe. [ 1 ] </>
Shani fights an uphill battle to keep Speranza safe. She could use a hand, but don't look at her sideways. </>
Shop </>
Quests </>
Check out the Quests overview page for more information. </>
References </>
↑ https://arcraiders.com/news/meet-the-traders-blog </>

title: Shields
text:
Shields are used by Raiders to negate incoming damage while Topside. Some shields reduce mobility for the upside of increased protection. Augments are needed to wear the higher end shields. </>
 </>
Name </>
Image </>
Description </>

Notes </>
Each blue box inside the shield bar is worth 10 shield points.   Shields do not act as extra health, but take a portion of the damage you've taken as shield damage instead. </>
Every free loadout will give you a light shield. </>
Used to the Weight perk from the Conditioning Skill Tree will reduce the effects of the movement penalty from the medium/heavy shields. </>
Damage Calculation </>
As long as the shield has at least 1 charge , it provides full damage mitigation . For example, if you have 1 shield charge and are hit by a Ferro, the damage is reduced as if the shield were fully charged . Damage mitigation only stops once the shield charge reaches 0 . </>
Shield Damage Formula </>
Let Y be the weapon’s base damage . </>
The shield’s charge is reduced by Y (headshot multipliers are ignored — shields always take body damage). </>
Your HP is reduced by Y after applying the shield’s deflection rate (e.g. 40% for a Light Shield). </>
Example </>
A Ferro body hit deals 40 base damage . </>
With a Light Shield (40% deflection) and at least 1 charge remaining: Shield charge is reduced by 40 HP damage taken: 24 instead of 40 </>
Shield charge is reduced by 40 </>
HP damage taken: 24 instead of 40 </>
Headshot Case </>
If the Ferro headshot deals 100 damage : </>
Shield charge is still reduced by 40 (base damage only) </>
HP damage taken: 60 (100 reduced by 40%) </>
In short: shield charge always absorbs base damage, while HP damage reflects the final hit after deflection . </>
Shield Durability </>
When shield charge is depleted, shield durability is reduced. [ 1 ] </>
At 100 durability, the shield can sustain 5 full charge depletions before it hits 0 durability and breaks: Light Shield can go from 40 charge to 0 charge five times, and then it breaks Light Shield can also go from 20 charge to 0 charge ten times before it breaks Heavy Shield can go from 80 charge to 0 charge five times before it breaks. </>
Light Shield can go from 40 charge to 0 charge five times, and then it breaks </>
Light Shield can also go from 20 charge to 0 charge ten times before it breaks </>
Heavy Shield can go from 80 charge to 0 charge five times before it breaks. </>
There is a very minor variance so sometimes the shield durability is left at 1 after 5 full shield charge depletions </>
References </>
↑ https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1KKQW145nfetydv1sRpYIxKgfPqQjR0FpQ1eYQA8YRYo/edit </>

title: Shredder
text:
</>
 </>
 </>
Shredder </>
 </>
Threat Level </>
High </>
 </>
Armor </>
Heavy </>
 </>
Primary Attack </>
Shrapnel Blast </>
 </>
Weakness </>
Thrusters </>
 </>
Stats </>
 </>
Health </>
480 [ 1 ] </>
The Shredder is a menacing ARC machine that floats a short distance off the ground. It appears in Stella Montis , challenging Raiders to stay sharp in close-quarter encounters. </>
Attack </>
The Shredder excels in closed quarters, like the halls of Stella Montis. </>
Fires a multi-round burst of shrapnel in all directions as its primary attack, dealing heavy area damage in enclosed spaces. </>
Periodically stops to “charge up” and then releases a larger blast/shrapnel cone; this charge gives a short window for counterplay, but is very dangerous if caught in the open. </>
It pursues players to close distance and favors engagements where cover and corners limit player escape routes. </>
Weaknesses & Hit Points </>
The Shredder's propulsion / thruster units (the blue jet / jet-propeller) are consistent weak points players can target for higher damage and to stagger it. </>
Explosives ( Trigger 'Nade , snap/fuse grenades, and other area explosives) are highly effective, especially when used during or just after the Shredder's charge animation. </>
Loot </>
The Shredder Gyro is a unique item dropped by the Shredder that's used to upgrade the Gunsmith . </>
Codex Entry </>
When this relentless lump of menace was first encountered at the Stella Montis facility , it left behind a trail of downed Raiders . It was dubbed the "Shredder" by what few Raiders managed to get back to safety; a name that wasn't so much clever as it was painfully literal. </>
History </>
 </>
Patch </>
Changes </>
 </>
1.7.0 </>
Reduced the amount of knockback applied by weapons. Increased movement speed and turning responsiveness. Increased health of the Shredder's head to prevent cases where its head could be shot off, leading to unintended behavior. Improved Shredder navigation to reduce getting stuck on corners, narrow spaces, and short obstacles. Increased the speed at which the Shredder enters combat when taking damage and when in close proximity to players. Increased the number of parts on the Shredder that can be individually destroyed. </>

title: Skills
text:
A Raider is more than just their gear. You can also invest Experience into a skill tree with three distinct specializations: Conditioning , Survival , and Mobility . Allocate points between branches in skill tree at your discretion, to create your unique build. </>
The default maximum skill points you can obtain is 76, gained from levels 0-75. However, completing Projects can grant bonus skill points above the maximum. </>
The current only Expedition Project will grant 1 skill point for each 1,000,000 of stash value (items & coin are added), up to a maximum of 5 additional skill points. </>
Can be reset in exchange for Coins, 2,000 Coins per skill point, however there is no option to reset specific nodes, instead the whole tree needs to be reset. </>

TURTLE CRAWL While downed, you take less damage. BACK ON YOUR FEET When you're critically hurt, your health regenerates until a certain limit. 🔒 REQUIRES 36 POINTS IN CONDITIONING A LITTLE EXTRA Breaching an object generates resources. LOADED ARMS Your equipped weapon has less impact on your encumbrance. GENTLE PRESSURE You make less noise when breaching. PROFICIENT PRYER Breaching doors and containers takes less time. UNBURDENED ROLL If your shield breaks, your first Dodge Roll within a few seconds does not cost stamina 🔒 REQUIRES 15 POINTS IN CONDITIONING EFFORTLESS SWING Melee abilities cost less stamina. SKY-CLEARING SWING You deal more melee damage to drones. FLYSWATTER Wasps and Turrets can now be destroyed with a single melee attack. 🔒 REQUIRES 36 POINTS IN CONDITIONING </>

↑ Exhaustion happen once stamina is depleted (flashing bar),recovery is the time after stamina depletion before you can sprint and roll. </>

Increases stamina regeneration by ~11.6% while being over-encumbered at max level. This is tested while standing still.
While looting, there's a chance to reveal twice as many items at once
When looting the "search" icon appears on two items in the container, instead of one. When the duration completes both items are revealed.
When looting Raider containers, you have a small chance of finding additional field-crafted items.
After an ability drains your stamina, you recover more quickly.
Reduces base recovery time from exhaustion [ 6 ] by 0.5s per point.
Looter's Luck or One Raider's Scraps & 36 Points in Survival.
Mines and explosive deployables can be defused when in close proximity
One Raider's Scraps or Three Deep Breaths & 36 Points in Survival.
Added Skill Tree Reset functionality in exchange for Coins, 2,000 Coins per skill point. </>

Introduction: </>
All of Speranza is buzzing about Stella Montis right now, and I admit it's caught my attention. Let the others sort out the whats and hows; I'm interested in the tech inside. </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
Have a look around. If you see anything significant that you can't bring back, take a photo. Oh, and, bring me back some new things, if you find any. </>

Don't forget about Stella Montis. That place isn't going to investigate itself, you know. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
Tian-Wen calling. Remember, you're not there to take in the sights. I'll need the details from you later. </>
Awaiting Completion: </>
The more I hear about Stella Montis, the more curious I get. </>
Upon Completion: </>
Neat. I can't wait to take these apart and see what I can find out about them. Thanks for the help. </>

title: Snitch
text:
</>
 </>
 </>
Snitch </>
 </>
Shani: Don't let it spot you, or it'll call in reinforcements. </>
 </>
Threat Level </>
Moderate </>
 </>
Armor </>
None </>
 </>
Primary Attack </>
None </>
 </>
Abilities </>
Summon ARC </>
 </>
Weakness </>
Thrusters </>
 </>
Stats </>
 </>
Health </>
158 [ 1 ] </>
The Snitch is an unarmed ARC reconnaissance drone that diligently scans the environment for human activity. It's equipped with the ability to call in reinforcements from orbit. </>
Combat </>
The Snitch does not have any weapons or armor. When it enters its alerted state, the Snitch will emit a loud siren to alert nearby ARC before calling for reinforcements comprising Wasps and Hornets . </>
Weaknesses & Hit Points </>
The thrusters of the Snitch can easily be identified by the white sections on its hull. Destroying two of them may cause the Snitch to begin falling towards the ground. This can instantly destroy the Snitch if it drops from a great height. However, a Snitch with one missing thruster will fly much more erratically, making it more difficult to hit. </>
Avoid being spotted by moving behind cover or hiding in foliage. </>
Destroy it before it can call for reinforcements. </>
Loot </>
The Snitch Scanner is a unique item dropped by the Snitch that's used to upgrade the Utility Station . </>
Codex Entry </>
Pesky and vigilant, the Snitch is an unarmed reconnaissance drone, equipped with advanced scanning technology. They are frequently found patrolling strategic areas or scouting ahead for other enemy units. If it detects any human threat, it calls in reinforcements from orbit. </>
The purpose of the Snitch seems to be to uphold communication networks and coordinate orbital drops. Shani refers to them as ARC 's "eyes in the sky"; calling in reinforcements and maintaining operational awareness. </>
The ability to call in reinforcements make Snitches a high-priority target for Raiders who want to avoid escalating encounters. However, some Raiders have been known to intentionally aggravate it in a bid to conveniently harvest Wasp and Hornet Drivers . </>
The Snitch Scanner , the stand-out component inside this drone, has been repurposed by many a Raider. Most notably, it triggers upon being thrown, calling in reinforcements that target any perceived threats in the Scanner's vicinity. </>
References </>
↑ Health value is currently an estimate; not based on a reliable source. </>

Source Of The Contamination is a Quest given by Celeste after completing Water Troubles . </>

Reach the Water Treatment Building in The Dam </>
Search for the Flood Spill Intake near the Swamp </>
Investigate any suspicious objects </>

Guide </>
Search for the Flood Spill Intake near the Swamp </>
Investigate any suspicious objects </>
Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
I'm not saying our water's been tampered with, but based on your samples, I can't rule out the possibility either. Would you return to the Dam, and see what's wrong? </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
See what you can dig up; we really can't afford this sickness spreading through our drinking water. </>
Idle: </>
I had Lance run some tests on the water sample you brought back, and the results are not great. This goes beyond natural contaminants. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
This is Celeste: Our Flood Spill Intake faces the swamp; it's easy to find if you locate the Water Treatment Building first. See if you can find anything that points to the source of the contamination. </>
Awaiting Completion: </>
Got a lead on the water supply? </>
Upon Completion: </>
You found something? Oh. Oh... this is bad. </>

title: Speranza
text:
Due to the ARC threat on the surface, humans have created a new living in the relative safety below the surface. It’s here Raiders come home to after visits Topside . Here you can perform various different actions and build your own personal home below. </>
Main Hub </>
This is where you can select which map you'll be going to topside, as well as choosing fellow Raiders to assist you. </>
Your active Feats and Quests are shown here as well. </>
Workshop </>
Make sure to check your Workshop to see what you can craft and what Scrappy has brought you from the Rust Belt! </>
You can check your Blueprints here as well by hitting R (by default on pc). </>
Stash </>
A place where you can keep everything you've found up on topside. The default stash size is 64 slots. </>
You can upgrade your stash with coin via the button "Expand" in the top left. Each stash upgrade increases the size of your stash by 24 slots with 280 being the base max. Raiders who have completed Expeditions will gain an extra 12 slots per completion. </>
 </>

575,000 </>
The Raider Den </>
A cozy bedroom to call your own. </>
Shani will be kind enough to lend you a cozy bedroom to call your own. Well, “cozy” might be stretching it. “Bedroom,” too. When you arrive, you’ll be greeted by a metal cot, peeling decorations, and a door frame with a notable lack of door. </>
From here you can explore your skill tree and change your Raider's appearance, amongst other things. </>
The Raider Den changes with your Raider's level, stash upgrades, and workshop upgrades. </>
Character </>
Customize your Raider with unique outfits and hairstyles, bought with Raider Tokens or unlocked in the Raider Decks . </>
You receive 1 skill point per level. Make sure to spend your points at the Skill Tree ! </>
Your Trial progress is also available to be checked here. </>
Don't forget to check on your Project's progress either! </>
The Codex is also available to read. It will log everything you discover topside! You can also check your completed quests here and stats as well. </>
Raider Decks </>
The Raider Decks , where you can spend Cred in order to unlock cosmetic rewards. There are a number of rewards to unlock per page in order to progress to the next page. The number of pages in each Raider Deck may vary. </>
Traders </>
Many Traders are down in Speranza : </>
Shani who mans security while selling binoculars and Raider Hatch Keys for Cred . </>
Lance will patch you up in a pinch with his meds, for a price of course. </>
Tian Wen has all the ammo you'll need, as well as a few basic Weapons and Modifications . </>
Apollo sells Quick Use items that are helpful in almost any scenario. </>
Celeste trades for Assorted Seeds in exchange for materials that every Raider needs. </>
Other Inhabitants </>
Some more or less well-known Speranza dwellers, and some of the wisdom they have shared: </>
Olayemi (Artisan; To-Do list enthusiast) — «Tracking crafting blueprints or quests can help you bring back the right loot.» </>
Deadshot David (Raider; Self-Coined Nickname) — «You're more accurate when standing still - and your duels look far more impressive.» </>
Zahir (Raider; Learned The Hard Way) — «Raider Hatches get you home quickly and discreetly - so long as you have a key.» </>
Eleonora (Raider; Dance-Off Expert) — «Many a tense situation has been deescalated with the Emote Wheel.» </>
Valentina (Tube Operator) — «The longer you stay topside, the fewer ways back remain.» </>
Gianni (Successful Raider; Unsuccessful Plumber) — «There are many problems bullets can’t solve - or so I’ve learned.» </>

title: Spotter
text:
</>
 </>
 </>
Spotter </>
 </>
Threat Level </>
High </>
 </>
Armor </>
None </>
 </>
Primary Attack </>
None </>
 </>
Abilities </>
Reveals Raiders </>
 </>
Weakness </>
Thrusters </>
 </>
Stats </>
 </>
Health </>
80 [ 1 ] </>
The Spotter will point a laser at any Raider in line-of-sight, so the Bombardier can accurately target them. </>
If both Spotters are destroyed, a new pair will respawn. When the Bombardier is destroyed, the Spotters will fly away. </>
Attack </>
Doesn't directly attack the player, but instead reveals the position of the player to the Bombardier by pointing a marking laser at them. </>
The laser needs to maintain a constant line of sight in order to work and can tag you even in places where the Bombardier can't shoot at you. </>
Combat Tips </>
The Spotter itself isn't a direct threat to you, but it can enable the Bombardier to engage you from very far distances, as well as from cover that would otherwise prevent the Bombardier from engaging. Killing both Spotters can "blind" the Bombardier, but the Spotters will eventually respawn, so it's ill-advised to do so constantly, as you will waste ammo or items to remove it for only a short period of time. </>
The Spotter can be nullified by using a variety of tactics that abuse the fact that it doesn't directly attack. First, you can get into a building that the Bombardier can't shoot into. This makes it to where even though the Spotter is actively targeting you, the Bombardier can't use the Spotter in order to shoot at you. Next, you can put a wall or object that breaks the line of sight of the Spotter, breaking the beam and forcing the Spotter to require you. Last, you can use Quick Use items in order to blind, stun, or disorient the Spotter in order to get away or get around it. </>
Loot Pool </>
The Spotter Relay is a unique item dropped by the Spotter. </>
Codex Entry </>
Often compared to the Snitch , the Spotter reconnaissance drone patrols and scans for Raiders . While it does not call in reinforcements directly, it does make a lot of fuss while relaying Raider positions to other ARC machines . </>
Despite its size, the Spotter can take considerable punishment. Combined with its unpredictable flight patterns, it's a frustrating opponent to pin down. </>
Hunting Spotters creates commotion and might draw the attention of opportunistic Raiders looking to eliminate the competition. </>
References </>
↑ Health value is currently an estimate; not based on a reliable source. </>

text:
</>
 </>

 </>

Straight Record is a quest given by Celeste . </>
Objectives </>

Guide </>
Straight Record Locations </>
Straight Record EMP Trap </>
Straight Record Power Switch #1 </>
Straight Record Power Switch #2 </>
Straight Record Power Switch #3 </>
Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
Back during the First Wave, my squad and I built a trap out by the Dam. Overloaded a generator, turned it into a makeshift ARC trap. Now I hear Raiders are using it to cut comms and spring ambushes on each other. I need you to end it. </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
Head out there and kill the power, pull the plug—do whatever it takes to shut it down. That trap was built to keep us safe, not for us to use against each other. </>
Idle: </>
We built that trap right when we thought we were done for. It was crude, but it saved our lives. I can't stand knowing it's out there, being used like this. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
Celeste here. Be on the lookout for that trap, Raider. It looks... Just as high-voltage as you'd imagine. </>
Upon Completion: </>
Thanks for handling that. That thing wasn't built to last, and it sure as hell wasn't supposed to be used for something like this. Damn fools should've known better. </>

title: ARC Surveyor
text:
</>
 </>
 </>
ARC Surveyor </>
 </>
Shani: They're often more scared of you than you are of them, but in a panic, they'll bulldoze you all the same. </>
 </>
Threat Level </>
Low </>
 </>
Armor </>
Heavy </>
 </>
Primary Attack </>
Rolling </>
 </>
Abilities </>
None </>
 </>
Weakness </>
Core </>
 </>
Stats </>
 </>
Health </>
257 [ 1 ] </>
The Surveyor is an unarmed, spherical ARC machine completely protected by an armored shell. </>
Behavior </>
The Surveyor is typically observed shooting a blue laser beam into the sky using a telescopic tool. As it does this, its armor plating is retracted and its vulnerable core is exposed. Presumably, the Surveyor's laser is used to communicate with ARC infrastructure and/or units in orbit. </>
The Surveyor can easily sense approaching Raiders . Once threatened, it will immediately finish what its doing and roll away at a speed faster than a Raider can sprint. Although it prefers to escape engagements, the Surveyor will not hesitate to roll into its attacker if left with no other option but to defend itself. This attack does a moderate amount of damage. Once it senses danger has passed, the Surveyor will resume its transmission. </>
While uncommon, the Surveyor has been observed rolling off ledges in certain scenarios when escaping an attacker. </>
Combat </>
Destroying the Surveyor can be tricky because it will immediately roll away at high speed when threatened or attacked. To quickly destroy the Surveyor, the best strategy is to first delay its escape by stunning it with a Hornet Driver or Showstopper while it's still exposing its core, and then throwing powerful explosives like Heavy Fuze Grenades to finish it off. </>
As the Surveyor takes damage, its armored panels can break off and be looted. Heavy Ammo is more effective at shedding its armor plating than most other Ammo types. </>
Loot </>
The Surveyor Vault is a unique item dropped by the Surveyor that's used to upgrade the Medical Lab . </>
Codex Entry </>
Evasive and mysterious, the ARC Surveyor is known amongst Raiders as a rich source of high-value ARC tech. </>
The Surveyor has been observed to roam the surface, and is believed to fill up data-banks with all kinds of measurements and analyses. </>
Although unarmed, it should be noted that the ARC Surveyor is not without defensive capabilities. If provoked, it may launch an attack and try to ram whomever is close by. </>
References </>
↑ Health value is currently estimated; not based on a reliable source. </>

There is a reservoir beneath the Spaceport; if we manage to route that water here, that should buy us time to deal with the contamination. </>

Go to the tunnels beneath the Spaceport; there should be a valve to reroute the water. Make sure you dodge ARC on the way there. </>

Shani's team is already tracking down the saboteurs; you focus on rerouting that water. </>

This is Celeste speaking: There are tunnels built underneath the Spaceport; there you'll find a valve to reroute the water. </>

Thanks for fixing the water. We only had enough reserve water for one more cup of coffee. </>
Upon Completion: </>
"Switching the Supply" video plays. </>

The Tactical Mk. 2 is a Rare Tactical Augment and the direct upgrade to the Tactical Mk. 1 , with more backpack slots and higher weight capacity. It introduces a unique passive, and one dedicated utility slot. </>
Compared to the Combat and Looting Augments, the Tactical Augment comes with one additional quick-use slot, for a total of 5. However, compared to the other Rare (Mk. 2) Augments, it has the lowest weight capacity and amount of backpack slots, and its weight capacity only increases by 5 from its lower-tier variant (compared to Looting and Combat's 10 additional weight capacity over their lower-tier variants). </>
