title: Talk:Augments
text:
Missing column for Augment descriptions </>
Hi there.  Great site and really love the format for the augments tables.  However, you are missing a valuable column for the special ability of the augment (where that applies).  For instance, the Looting Mk2 augment "Throws off ticks after 1s", the Looting Mk3 (Survivor) augment "While downed and stationary, health regenerates up to 75% of max downed health", etc.  Thanks for your consideration. SmoothG ( talk ) 20:30, 12 January 2026 (UTC) Reply </>

title: Talk:Loot
text:
Recipes Page </>
Can we get a sub-section or new page dedicated to recipes? I want to port over the list and how to find them. </>
Thanks! Redstone Gamer 1 ( talk ) 14:55, 26 May 2025 (UTC) Reply </>
Why was the "recycles from" column removed? </>
I spent hours getting all that info and it was removed without any note. I'm just wondering why. I feel it is important to know what items can be recycled into the item you're looking for without having to click through to every single page. LinkinBreak ( talk ) 01:05, 2 November 2025 (UTC) Reply </>
Expedition Requirements </>
The batteries on the loot table don't say they are needed for the expedition. I think players using this will be upset after recycling them and find out they need 30 of them. I created an account just to add this. Anyways, thanks for all for your hard work! </>
(1/6) </>
150 Metal Parts, 200 Rubber Parts, 80 Arc Alloy, 15 Steel Spring. </>
(2/6) </>
35 Durable Cloth, 30 Wires, 30 Electrical Component, 5 Cooling Fans. </>
(3/6) </>
5 Lightbulbs, 30 Battery, 20 Sensors, 1 Exodus Module. </>
(4/6) </>
5 Humidifier, 5 Advanced Electrical Components, 3 Magnetic Accelerators, 3 Leaper Pulse Units. </>
(5/6) - Doesn't need to be included in table, but figured I would add it. </>
250k "combat Items", 100k "Survival Items", 180K "Provisions", 300K "Materials". </>
(6/6) </>
"N/A" Jimdanndy ( talk ) 17:35, 3 November 2025 (UTC) Reply </>
sort by loot type </>
security, technological, mechanical, industrial, etc. </>
could add another column for it. just a thought. MarSea ( talk ) 16:37, 6 November 2025 (UTC) Reply </>
Add Snap blast </>
you can recycle it and get magnet and i forgot the other 1 Move ( talk ) 12:59, 11 November 2025 (UTC) Reply </>
Column for found in </>
Add a column for the sector that the loot can be found in, EX. Exodus Modules in Exodus or Bandages in Medical Noahh8742 ( talk ) 05:16, 21 November 2025 (UTC) Reply </>
Flow Controller is Missing </>
I'm fairly certain Flow Controller used to exist on this page. Is there a reason it was removed? If it never existed, I could add it. Kiwi ( talk ) 00:21, 28 December 2025 (UTC) Reply </>
Some items Recycle To/From incorrect </>
Some items have incorrect Recycle information. For example "Great Mullein" recycles into 2 "Assorted Seeds", not 4, and "Sensors" only recycles in 1 "Wires" and "Metal Parts", not 2 of each. Not sure of any others or if these were updated recently. ApocalypticSun9 ( talk ) 06:49, 8 January 2026 (UTC) Reply </>
Column for whats needed and what to sell </>
So really loved having the column that had the requirements of workshop needed items/quests/scrappy </>
I propose we add a column {if not putting it back} of Always Sell, Always Recycle, Needed for quests/scrappy/events </>
I really hate that i now have to flip between pages to see what i need to keep mid match >.< SewSpooky ( talk ) 03:15, 11 January 2026 (UTC) Reply </>

title: Talk:Maps
text:
subheaders for each loot area </>
Should we add individual subheaders for each loot area on each map? like primary facility, testing annex, etc. with descriptions of the layout and loot of the area. MarSea ( talk ) 16:22, 6 November 2025 (UTC) Reply </>
Map Modifier Difficulty Changes </>
I feel like changing the description when the map difficulty changes due to a modifier from "Still ___" to "No Change", this would give the reader more solid info and we could even put "No Change (difficulty)" to help them even more. Noahh8742 ( talk ) 17:07, 14 November 2025 (UTC) Reply </>

title: Talk:Quests
text:
Spoiling Progression </>
During my playtime I realized I missed some clue, hint or cant seem to find the objective, coming from tarkov I expected the wiki to have a dedicated solution to basically any quest. Is this not appreciated here? Is there any way to make a spoiler section that one has to accept to see a more detailed description of quest objectives and locations? Coru ( talk ) 12:07, 15 November 2025 (UTC) Reply </>

Add another column to the table to show the augment that the shield is capable with. Noahh8742 ( talk ) 16:30, 20 November 2025 (UTC) Reply </>
Health </>
Under "Headshot Case" is the first time I have seen information indicating that the health bar is indeed 100 HP. </>
I wonder if there should be a separate wiki page that discusses health in general including this detail, and then leads to healing and revives. Woalis ( talk ) 17:01, 31 December 2025 (UTC) Reply </>

title: Talk:Skills
text:
What's the level cap? </>
I would like to know how many points I can distribute on the skill tree Peniddo ( talk ) 07:57, 26 September 2025 (UTC) Reply </>
Trial Respec / Respec </>
I believe that there should be a trial respec for a certain number of points or just 1 free respec per "reset", there's not a lot of clarity on how much certain points effect your character so its a lot of trial and error along with not knowing if there was a level cap, I assumed there wouldn't be, but just found out there was one at lvl 75 and don't have enough points to get the capstone skill I want now. </>
If I put 5 levels into a skill and it doesn't feel good that just feels really bad that I now have to deal with that for the next 2 months.   It also doesn't have to be free, I would pay a heft fee to be able to do this. Just trying to have this reach the devs to see if this would be a possibility. Qwazarr ( talk ) 16:21, 4 November 2025 (UTC) Reply </>
Interactive skill map typo </>
The "Used to the weight" skill description in the interactive skill tree has a typo, but I don't know how to edit a widget. LeAlexo ( talk ) 16:41, 6 November 2025 (UTC) Reply </>
typo </>
every instance of "Lets" i've seen here has an incorrect apostrophe. like security breach is "Let's you breach security lockers" whereas it should be "Lets". I just don't know how to edit interactive models. MarSea ( talk ) 18:00, 7 November 2025 (UTC) Reply </>
Datamining for Values </>
Is anybody able to figure out the coded values for these skills that incrementally increase x mechanic? Like finding the % chance value for Looter's Luck to proc, or how much of a decrease there is in time to breach with Proficient Pryer? Glxy ( talk ) 17:07, 2 December 2025 (UTC) Reply </>

Thanks! Redstone Gamer 1 ( talk ) 13:58, 26 May 2025 (UTC) Reply </>
Table layouts </>
This topic is about any table layout in weapons and equipments pages. Using '+' between every element of every craft/recycling seems uselessly overbearing. I'm pretty sure anybody would understand if we just keep one element per line without delimiter, the "and" being implicit. Or maybe we could put the '+' or a ',' at the end of each line to keep it explicit and divide the tables heights by 2. Also, the 'Or' could be replaced by a '/' at the end of each line. GUYS WHERE GETTING A NEW LEGENDARY </>
I'm really new to wiki and I'm trying to add stuff for the new update coming nov 13 and we getting a new legendary so like what do we do????? Anormalraider05 ( talk ) 19:00, 12 November 2025 (UTC) Reply </>
Aphelion Class </>
Where should the aphelion go? All I've heard so far is that it's an Energy Burst(?) Battle Rifle, so I'm thinking it belongs in the battle rifles section. Noahh8742 ( talk ) 17:21, 14 November 2025 (UTC) Reply </>
Kettle Category </>
The Kettle belongs in the Pistols category. One because it is semi automatic, and the official definition of an Assault Rifle is a rifle that is capable of both Semi and Automatic firing modes. Sure, it may be able to be clicked fast on PC to simulate a AR and also may have a faster fire rate than most pistols, but on other platforms like PS5, it cannot be clicked as fast and therefore is a pistol. Please stop putting it in the "Assault Rifles" category. :/ Noahh8742 ( talk ) 13:32, 21 November 2025 (UTC) Reply </>
Relative DPS is false </>
The relative damage per second in the info tables is just (Damage * Firing rate) but firing rate isn't measured in how many times a gun can shoot in a second. Therefor the Relative DPS stat is really misleading and should either be removed or edited to be more accurate. Hisse ( talk ) 19:16, 2 January 2026 (UTC) Reply </>

Intro/Description: </>
You know what I've been dreaming of lately? A talking water distiller! Crazy, huh? But seriously, with purer compounds I could make explosives with more oumph! Would be something, right? </>

The purification system in the Spaceport tunnels could serve as the basis for my designs. Would you monitor it for me? </>

I got my hands full, so no rush with that distiller. Would be great to finish my designs, though. </>

Hey. Apollo here. Listen: I'd start checking the water distillation system in the underground tunnels. Should be a lot to learn there for my own designs. </>
Upon Completion: </>
Wow, you found outright water distiller blueprints? This is better than I imagined, thanks a lot! </>

Majors footlocker map </>

Dialog </>
Introduction: </>
I have another job. It's.. about my mom*. </>
Those First Wave sites I sent you to before? I actually hoped you'd find something of my mother's. She fought in the Raider resistance. It was a long shot; but now I've got an actual lead. </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
I found out where mum may have bunkered, during the First Wave. Perhaps... Perhaps she left something behind. </>
Idle: </>
About my mum's things... You've already done a lot for me. I just want you to know that it's okay if you don't find it. Really. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
This is Tian-Wen. My source mentioned the Ruby Residence, and the Pale Apartments. My mum's name was Aiva, if that helps. </>
Upon Completion: </>
That's hers. I can tell. I thought it'd be gone forever. You don't know what it means to have it back. Thank you. </>
Notes </>
Despite both Tian Wen and the subtitles saying "mum" the description has it written as "mom". </>

The Queen is one of the largest and most dangerous ARC machines discovered to date. It's can only be found guarding Harvesters when the relevant Map Modifier is active. </>
Attack </>
Will fire 2-5 mortars from the top of her dome that will land around the Raider and explode into a fiery inferno 2 seconds after impact. </>
Will fire a laser beam periodically at a Raider in line-of-sight that leaves the ground scorched and hot to the touch. </>
Will switch between an EMP pulse or a ground slam when Raiders try to get up close and personal. </>

The Queen is a massive, six-legged beast, often spotted guarding Harvesters. With its imposing appearance, extremely powerful attacks, and strategic area control, the Queen is pure trouble in metal form. </>
It is speculated the Queen shares kinship with the First Wave 's Baron , although it is a much improved piece of machinery. ARC seems to use it to protect Harvesters, and fend off threats from the most valuable probing and resource extraction sites. </>

title: Tian Wen
text:
Most people underground haven’t seen more of Tian Wen than her eyes. Speranza ’s resident gun craftsman, Tian Wen is a recluse who seemingly prefers the company of her tools to any human being. She wears her disdain for most Raiders on her sleeve, and only interacts with them out of her own interests. But while she would never admit it, she has a soft spot or two for things in need of repair — action figures, weapons, and sometimes even people. [ 1 ] </>
Some call Tian Wen the "gun nut", but that's just half the truth. She also has a supernatural knack for tech and construction. </>
Shop </>
Quests </>
Check out the Quests overview page for more information. </>
References </>
↑ https://arcraiders.com/news/meet-the-traders-blog </>

title: Tick
text:
</>
 </>

Tick </>
 </>
Shani: They'll go straight for your face if you let them, and they rarely come alone. </>
 </>
Threat Level </>

The Tick is a small, spider-like ARC machine that leaps at Raiders. </>
Combat </>
When in its Aggressive state, the Tick will make a robotic shuffling sound prior to it lunging toward the Raider's head. It will latch itself onto the Raider, slowly draining health and shield. Hold [interact] to dislodge the Tick. Once dislodged, the Tick will run along the ground to escape, and may try to lunge at you again. </>
Tips </>
The Tick can be often be heard before it's seen. </>
Loot </>
The Tick Pod is a unique item dropped by the Tick that's used to upgrade the Medical Lab . </>
Codex Entry </>
The bane of anyone who values their face-adjacent personal space, the Tick is a small, spider-like machine that leaps at Raiders , munching away at whatever exposed skin it can find. It is predominately found indoors, crawling on walls and ceilings. </>
The Tick is a relentless, parasitic creature that often attacks in small groups. While individual Ticks can be easily swatted off, hordes of them are another matter entirely. </>
The Tick's speculated purpose is to drive humans away from areas being probed for resources; acting as a contamination agent to create exclusion zones. Fortunately, Ticks emit a distinct sound when activated making their presence known. </>
Lance used to collect destroyed Ticks "because they are cute", hanging them from rafters and as ornaments in plants. He was talked out of this habit when children refused to enter his clinic. </>
References </>
↑ Health value is currently an estimate, not based on a reliable source. </>

title: Topside
text:
Topside is the place where you spend most of your time in ARC Raiders looking for valuable loot. It's a general term for all playable maps . </>
The first thing you have to be aware of is that you are not alone up there, ARC machines and Raiders who prey on others will be looking for you. </>
While teamwork among Raiders is encouraged, raiding itself is not regulated, and some Raiders choose to prey on and steal from one another. </>

title: Traders
text:
In Speranza , everyone has their own agenda. The traders are no different. Some still cling to the past, driven by a flicker of hope and a moral compass. Others have become hardened and self-serving. </>
For you, what matters is that the Traders keep you employed. They’ll offer you quests to collect valuable supplies on the surface, and in return, you may slowly come to learn more about who they are, and what their vision for Speranza is. </>

Trials </>
Raiders are given 5 Trials Challenges every week, which can be viewed in the Trials menu. When completing an action listed in a challenge, Raiders will earn points towards that challenge. Raiders can gain double the challenge points adventuring into maps with major map conditions, these include Night Raid , Electromagnetic Storm , Hidden Bunker , Locked Gate and Cold Snap </>
Upon extraction, the Raider's points for each challenge are tallied. Only a Raider's best score in each challenge is kept. Reaching certain point thresholds grants the Raider with rewards. </>
Below is a list of currently known challenges: </>

Divisions </>
Once a Raider has at least one point in a given week, they are placed in a division of 100 total Raiders, all of which are at the same rank. Divisions are filled on a first-come, first-serve basis (e.g. The first 100 Raiders to score a point in Trials each week will be placed together, then the next 100 Raiders, etc). Raiders are ranked according to the combined score of their personal best runs in each challenge. On Monday, Raiders will change ranks depending on their place in their division's leaderboard. </>
The exception to this is the Cantina Legend rank, which is reserved for the top 1000 players in Hotshot. </>
Ranks </>
There are 14 total ranks in Trials. Each rank rewards new cosmetics once the Trial season ends. Each rank title is split into three sub-ranks, with the exception of Hotshot and Cantina Legend. New starting Raiders begin at Rookie I, but in a new season Raiders start at 2 ranks below their last placement (Daredevil II on Season 1 would let you start as Wildcard III on Season 2). </>

Rewards </>
There are two forms of rewards a Raider can receive from Trials: challenge rewards, and seasonal rewards. </>
Challenge Rewards </>
Challenge rewards are earned by reaching 1000, 2500, and 4000 points on a trial. These reward a random Uncommon, Rare, and Epic item or blueprint , respectively. Challenge rewards claimed automatically after you extract from the map. Rewards can only be claimed once per challenge tier per week. </>
Season Rewards </>
At the end of a season, Raiders are rewarded with cosmetics and emotes based on their final ranked placement. Finishing with a high rank rewards all of the items from the lower ranks. </>

Tribute To Toledo is a Quest given by Celeste after completing Life Of A Pharmacist . </>
Objectives </>
Get a Power Rod for Celeste </>
Rewards </>
5x Magnet </>
2x Advanced Mechanical Components </>
3x Synthesized Fuel </>
Guide </>
You can recycle a Snap Hook to obtain the Power Rod in a pinch. Alternatively, the Power Generation Complex on Dam Battlegrounds can be searched for machinery that can be breached. They have an increased drop rate for Power Rods. </>
Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
The Official Toledo Tubes Management is demanding one of our Power Rods for usage of "their" Slingshot tubes. Don't let the name fool you, they're in no way official; just thugs with lots of power. Could you help me with this? </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
Thanks. Check around the generators for the Dam, and see if you can't scrounge up a Power Rod. We'll try to pass it off as one of our own. </>
Idle: </>
Ugh... I was hoping I wouldn't have to involve someone else in this, but I'm out of options. I swear this is the last time they try and extort me like this... </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
Celeste here: If you're after that power rod I need, start by looking around the Generator Hall. </>
Awaiting Completion: </>
You got the Power Rod? </>
Upon Completion: </>
Good. Hopefully those thugs won't be able to tell the difference between this rod and our own. I'll have Apollo take a look at this before sending it off. </>

Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
I got a plan. If we recover with the evidence against the OTTM before they get to it, we might get them off our backs once and for all. </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
Your job is to go to the Spaceport and find the files. Take this key to the North Trench Tower. I had to bribe Shani with a jar of candied apricots for it, so keep it safe. </>
Idle: </>
Since we intercepted that dead drop, it will probably take a while for the Official Toledo Tubes Management to go search for the evidence against them. If we pull this off, I'm going to hang this over their heads every time they demand payment for using 'their' tubes. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
This is Celeste. Remember, Raider: the evidence against the Tubes Management should be in the North Trench Tower. Don't lose the key. </>
Awaiting Completion: </>
You are quickly becoming my favorite Raider around here. </>
Upon Completion: </>
Raider, I can't thank you enough. This info will allow me to secure free access to the Tubes moving forward. Now, I just need to subtly drop the hint that I've got something they'd rather keep under wraps... </>

title: Turret
text:
</>
 </>
 </>
Turret </>
 </>
Shani: You'll find them lurking indoors; try to take them out before they spot you. </>
 </>
Threat Level </>
Moderate </>
 </>
Armor </>
None </>
 </>
Primary Attack </>
Projectile </>
 </>
Stats </>
 </>
Health </>
80 [ 1 ] </>
The crude, stationary Turret can be found in buildings all over the Rust Belt. The unit is equipped with a sweeping scanner and a gun capable of unleashing barrages of bullets. </>
Although a nuisance, the Turret scanner emits visible light, allowing them to be avoided by attentive Raiders. It is also not particularly hard to destroy if spotted in time. </>
Attack </>
When in its aggressive state, it will lock onto the Raider and fire a constant stream of bullets, dealing moderate damage. If the Raider leaves its line of sight, it will fire at their last known location for a short time. </>
Combat Tips </>
The Turret has no armor plating and can be quickly destroyed using only a few bullets from any Ammo type. </>
Attacks can be avoided by </>
Quickly peaking from cover and shooting </>
Maintaining your distance </>
Loot </>
Codex Entry </>
The crude, stationary Turret can be found in buildings all over the Rust Belt. The unit is equipped with a sweeping scanner and a gun capable of unleashing barrages of bullets. </>
It is speculated that Turrets deploy and mount themselves autonomously, though it is unknown to what extent. What is clear though is that they are spread in generous numbers and force Raiders to be constantly on guard. </>
Although a nuisance, the Turret scanner emits visible light, allowing them to be avoided by attentive Raiders. It is also not particularly hard to destroy if spotted in time. </>
References </>
↑ Health value is currently an estimate, not based on a reliable source. </>

 </>
The Blue Gate </>
Still 4/5 </>
Uncovered Caches is a map modifier that significantly increases the number of Raider Caches scattered on the map. Additionally, the value of loot inside of Raider Caches is increased for the duration of this event. </>
Raider Caches can be found by listening for a low whirling noise accompanied by a higher-pitched ticking sound, or by looking for small, red arrow-shaped signs pointing towards the cache in the ground. </>

A Symbol Of Unification </>
Unexpected Initiative is a quest given by Tian Wen . </>
This quest is only available after both Industrial Espionage and Echoes Of Victory Ridge are completed. </>
Objectives </>
In One Round </>
Reach the Grandioso Apartments in Buried City </>
Search for Moisture Meter on the rooftop of the Grandioso Apartments </>
Reach Piazza Roma in Buried City </>
Search for a Nutrient Meter in the broken rooftop gardens at Piazza Roma </>
Rewards </>
1x Il Toro I </>
40x Shotgun Ammo </>
1x Shotgun Choke II </>
Guide </>
Piazza Roma Rooftop Location </>
Piazza Roma Nutrient Meter Location </>
Grandioso Apts. Rooftop Location </>
Grandioso Apts. Quest Item </>
Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
I'm setting up a greenhouse, to help boost our food production. I'm doing Celeste a solid, alright? Thats all. But enough about that. I've got all the details worked out, but I'll need supplies, and I'm not hauling them alone. </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
Good. </>
Idle: </>
Normally I wouldn't bother with something as dull as greenhouses, but the abysmal state of our kitchens is getting to me. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
Tian Wen [ 1 ] here, listen up: Remember the fertilizer I asked you to get? I'd tell you to look out for planters, but you can probably just follow your nose. </>
Upon Completion: </>
That's everything I asked for. I'll handle the rest. </>
Notes </>
↑ Misspelled in the subtitles as "Tian-When" </>
History </>
 </>
Patch </>
Changes </>
 </>
1.7.0 </>
Objectives changed from a water pump and fertilizer to a moisture meter and nutrient meter </>
Objectives changed from a water pump and fertilizer to a moisture meter and nutrient meter </>

text:
</>

A Balanced Harvest </>
 </>

The Root Of The Matter </>
Untended Garden is a quest given by Celeste . </>
Objectives </>
In One Round </>
Go to the Hydroponic Dome Complex </>
Access the data archive in one of the domes </>
Upload the data to the computer terminal in any Field Depot </>
Rewards </>
3x Advanced Mechanical Components </>
3x Heavy Gun Parts </>
5x Canister </>
Guide </>
The data is located in the northwest most dome in one the computers </>
Location of the building with the data </>
Collect research data from the computer terminal </>
Upload the research data to any field depot. The closest one is southwest of the building where you collected the data and should be visible on the map. </>
Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
According to the files you found in the lab, the cultivation researchers were actually the ones who set up the hydroponic domes out in the swamp. Sounds like the most obvious place to search next, don't you think? </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
So it all circles back to the domes again, huh. </>
Idle: </>
The hydroponic domes might hold information that's gone overlooked, if it hasn't been scavenged already. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
Celeste here. Be careful when you head to the domes, Raider; whatever they were growing there, it seems to have attracted all kinds of attention. </>
Upon Completion: </>
I always suspected that their cultivation project failed, but they may have been able to salvage something. Let me go through these notes, and get back to you. </>

title: Update:1.7.0
text:
</>
 </>
Update 1.7.0 - Cold Snap Update </>
 </>
Source </>
Patch Notes Update 1.7.0 </>
 </>
Release </>
16 December 2025 </>
 </>
Previous </>
Update:1.6.0 </>
 </>
Next </>
Update:1.7.2 </>
What’s New? </>
Cold Snap Map Condition </>
Flickering Flames Event </>
New Free Raider Deck “Goalie”  - coming on December 26 </>
New Quests and Items </>
Expedition Departure Window </>
Patch Highlights </>
Added Skill Tree Reset functionality. </>
Added an option to toggle Aim Down Sights. </>
Wallet now shows your Cred soft cap. </>
Various festive items to get you into the holiday spirit. </>
Moved the Aphelion blueprint drop from the Matriarch to Stella Montis. </>
Added Raider Tool customization. </>
Fixed various collision issues on maps. </>
Improved Stella Montis spawn distance checks to address the issue of players spawning too close to each other. </>
Balance Changes </>
Weapons </>
Bettina </>
Dev note: These changes aim to make the Bettina a bit less reliant on bringing a secondary weapon. The weapon should now be a bit more competent in PVP, without tipping the scales too much. Data shows that this weapon is still the highest performing PVE weapon at its rarity (Not counting the Hullcracker). The durability should also feel more in line with our other assault rifles. </>
Durability Burn Rate has been reduced from ~0.43% to ~0.17% per shot In practice, it used to take about 12 full magazines to fully deplete durability, but now it takes 26 (also accounting for the increased magazine size). </>
In practice, it used to take about 12 full magazines to fully deplete durability, but now it takes 26 (also accounting for the increased magazine size). </>
Base Magazine Size has been increased from 20 to 22 </>
Base Reload Time has been reduced from 5 to 4.5 </>
Rattler </>
Dev note: Even though the Rattler isn't intended to compete with the Stitcher or Kettle at close ranges, it is receiving a minor buff to bring its PVP TTK at lower levels a bit closer to the Stitcher and Kettle. The weapon should remain in its intended role as a more deliberate weapon where players are expected to dip in and out of cover, fire in controlled bursts, and manage their reloads. </>
Base Magazine Size has been increased from 10 to 12 </>
ARC </>
Shredder </>
Reduced the amount of knockback applied by weapons. Increased movement speed and turning responsiveness. </>
Increased health of the Shredder's head to prevent cases where its head could be shot off, leading to unintended behavior. </>
Improved Shredder navigation to reduce getting stuck on corners, narrow spaces, and short obstacles. </>
Increased the speed at which the Shredder enters combat when taking damage and when in close proximity to players. </>
Increased the number of parts on the Shredder that can be individually destroyed. </>
Content and Bug Fixes </>
Achievements </>
Achievements are now enabled in the Epic store. </>
Animation </>
Fixed an issue where picking up a Field Crate with a Trigger ’Nade attached could cause the character to slide or move without input. </>
Fixed an issue where combining Snap Hook with ziplines or ladders could store momentum and propel the player long distances. </>
Fixed an issue where the running animation could appear incorrect after a small drop when over-encumbered. </>
Interactions now end correctly when performing a dodge roll. </>
Interacting while holding items or deployables no longer causes arm twisting. </>
Added more animations to character skins and equipment to make them more natural. </>
ARC </>
Fixed an issue where deployables attached to enemies could cause them to launch or clip out of bounds when shot. </>
Missiles no longer reverse course after passing a target and can correctly track targets at different elevations. </>
Sentinel Fixed a bug where the Sentinel laser did not reach the targeted player over greater distances. </>
Fixed a bug where the Sentinel laser did not reach the targeted player over greater distances. </>
Surveyor Disabled vaulting onto ARC Surveyors to prevent unintended launches when they are moving. </>
Disabled vaulting onto ARC Surveyors to prevent unintended launches when they are moving. </>
Fixed an issue where Bombardier projectiles could shoot through the Matriarch shield from the outside. </>
Audio </>
Fixed an issue where Gas, Stun, and Impulse Mines did not play their trigger sound or switch their light to yellow when triggered by being shot. </>
Increased the number of simultaneous footstep sounds and increased their priority. </>
Fixed an issue where footsteps in metal stairs became very quiet when walking slowly. </>
Improved directional sound for ARC enemies. </>
Added sounds for sending and receiving text chat messages in the main menu. </>
Removed the unsettling "mom?" from Speranza cantina ambient sound. </>
Tweaked the loudness of announcements in various Main Menu screens. </>
Number of small audio bugfixes and polish. </>
Maps </>
Fixed an issue with spawning logic which could cause players who were reconnecting at the start of a session to spawn next to other players who had just joined. </>
Various collision, geometry, VFX and texture fixes that address gaps in terrain which made players fall through the map or walk inside geometry, stuck spots, camera clipping through walls, see-through geometry, floating objects, texture overlaps, etc. </>
Fixed an issue with the slope of the Raider Hatch that was too steep for downed raiders to crawl on top of it. </>
Security Lockers are now dynamically spawned across all maps instead of being statically placed. </>
Fixed Raider Caches not spawning during Prospecting Probes in some cases. </>
Fixed lootable containers and Supply Drops spawning inside terrain on The Dam and Blue Gate, ensuring they are accessible. </>
Fixed an issue where doors could appear closed for some players despite being open. </>
Electromagnetic Storm: Lightning strikes sometimes leave behind a valuable item. </>
Increased the number of possible Great Mullein spawn locations across all maps. </>
Dam Battlegrounds Moved the Matriarch's spawn point in Dam Battlegrounds to an area that better plays to her strengths. </>
Moved the Matriarch's spawn point in Dam Battlegrounds to an area that better plays to her strengths. </>
Spaceport Adjusted the locked room protection area in Container Storage on Spaceport to not affect players outside the room. </>
Adjusted the locked room protection area in Container Storage on Spaceport to not affect players outside the room. </>
Blue Gate Locked Gate map condition has been added. Adjusted map bounds near a ledge in Blue Gate to improve navigation and reduce abrupt out-of-bounds stops. Improved tree LODs in Blue Gate to reduce overly dark visuals at distance. Fixed the issue where loot would spawn outside the Locked Room in the Village. Added props and visual cues to the final camp in the quest ‘A First Foothold’ to make objective locations easier to find. </>
Locked Gate map condition has been added. </>
Adjusted map bounds near a ledge in Blue Gate to improve navigation and reduce abrupt out-of-bounds stops. </>
Improved tree LODs in Blue Gate to reduce overly dark visuals at distance. </>
Fixed the issue where loot would spawn outside the Locked Room in the Village. </>
Added props and visual cues to the final camp in the quest ‘A First Foothold’ to make objective locations easier to find. </>
Stella Montis Increased some item and blueprint spawn rates in Stella Montis. Some breachable containers on Stella Montis no longer drop Rubber Ducks when using the A Little Extra skill (sorry). Adjusted window glass clarity in Stella Montis to improve visibility. </>
Increased some item and blueprint spawn rates in Stella Montis. </>
Some breachable containers on Stella Montis no longer drop Rubber Ducks when using the A Little Extra skill (sorry). </>
Adjusted window glass clarity in Stella Montis to improve visibility. </>
Miscellaneous </>
General crash fixes (including AMD crashes). </>
Added Skill Tree Reset functionality in exchange for Coins, 2,000 Coins per skill point. </>
Wallet now shows your Cred soft cap (800). Dev note: We decided to implement a cap so that players won’t be able to fully unlock new Raider Decks by accumulating Cred and added more items to Shani’s store to purchase using Cred. We believe that the Raider Decks offer a rewarding experience to enjoy while players engage with the game, and a large Cred wallet undermines this goal. We will not be removing Cred that has been accumulated before the introduction of the soft cap. </>
Dev note: We decided to implement a cap so that players won’t be able to fully unlock new Raider Decks by accumulating Cred and added more items to Shani’s store to purchase using Cred. We believe that the Raider Decks offer a rewarding experience to enjoy while players engage with the game, and a large Cred wallet undermines this goal. We will not be removing Cred that has been accumulated before the introduction of the soft cap. </>
Added Raider Tool customization. </>
Fixed a bug that caused players to spawn on servers without their gear and in default customization resulting in losing loadout items. </>
For ranks up to Daredevil I, leaderboards now have a 3x promotion zone for the top 5 players. New objectives have been added. </>
Fixed an issue where the tutorial door breach could be canceled, preventing the cutscene from playing and blocking progression. </>
Fixed an issue where players could continue breaching doors while downed. </>
Fixed an issue where accepting a Discord invite without having your account linked could fail to place you into the inviter’s party. </>
Fixed an issue that sometimes caused textures and meshes to flicker between higher and lower quality states. </>
Depth of field amount is now scaled correctly depending on your resolution scale. </>
Fixed an issue where returning to the game after alt-tabbing could prevent movement and ability inputs while camera controls still worked. </>
Improved input handling when the game window regains focus to avoid unexpected input mode switches. </>
Skill Tree </>
Effortless Roll skill now provides greater stamina cost reduction. </>
The Calming Stroll skill now applies while moving in ADS. </>
Movement </>
Fixed a traversal issue that blocked jumping/climbing in certain areas while crouched. </>
Fixed an issue where climbing ladders over open gaps could cause automatic detachment. </>
A slight stamina cost has been added for entering a slide. </>
Acceleration has been reduced when doing a dodge roll from a slide. </>
UI </>
Added an option to toggle Aim Down Sights. </>
Added a new ‘Cinematic’ graphics setting to enhance visuals for high end PCs. </>
Codex Improved accuracy of tracking damage dealt in player stats. Field-crafted items now properly count toward Player Stats in the Codex. Fixed missing sound in Codex Records. Added a Codex section to rewatch previously seen videos. </>
Improved accuracy of tracking damage dealt in player stats. </>
Field-crafted items now properly count toward Player Stats in the Codex. </>
Fixed missing sound in Codex Records. </>
Added a Codex section to rewatch previously seen videos. </>
Console Updated PlayStation 5 controller button prompts with improved icons for Options and Share. Fixed a crash when using Show Profile from the Player Info on Xbox. </>
Updated PlayStation 5 controller button prompts with improved icons for Options and Share. </>
Fixed a crash when using Show Profile from the Player Info on Xbox. </>
Customization You can now rotate your character in the customization screen. Also fixed an issue where the first equip could trigger an unintended unequip. Added notifications in Character Customization to highlight recently unlocked items. Fixed an issue where equipment customization items bought from the Loadout screen were not equipped after pressing Equip on the purchase screen. </>
You can now rotate your character in the customization screen. Also fixed an issue where the first equip could trigger an unintended unequip. </>
Added notifications in Character Customization to highlight recently unlocked items. </>
Fixed an issue where equipment customization items bought from the Loadout screen were not equipped after pressing Equip on the purchase screen. </>
End of round Further reduced the frequency of the end of round feedback survey pop up. Added an optional Round Feedback button on the final end-of-round screen to open a short post-match survey. </>
Further reduced the frequency of the end of round feedback survey pop up. </>
Added an optional Round Feedback button on the final end-of-round screen to open a short post-match survey. </>
Expedition Project Added a show/hide tooltip hint to the Raider Projects screens (Expedition and Seasonal). Added 'Expeditions Completed' to Player Stats. Added resource tracking for Expedition stages: Raider Projects now display required amounts and progress, with the tracker updating during rounds. Added reward display to Raider Projects, showing the rewards for each goal and at Expedition completion. Fixed an input conflict in Raider Projects where tracking a resource in Expeditions could also open the About Expeditions window; the on-screen prompt is now hidden while adding to Load Caravan. </>
Added a show/hide tooltip hint to the Raider Projects screens (Expedition and Seasonal). </>

Inventory Fixed an issue where closing the right-click menu in the inventory could reset focus to a different slot when using a gamepad. Fixed flickering in the inventory tooltip. Opening the inventory during a breach now cancels the interaction to prevent a brief animation glitch. Adjusted the inventory screen layout to prevent tooltips from appearing immediately upon opening. Fixed an issue where the weapon slot right-click menu in the inventory would not appear after navigating from an empty attachment slot with a controller. </>
Fixed an issue where closing the right-click menu in the inventory could reset focus to a different slot when using a gamepad. </>

In-game Fixed an issue where the climb prompt would not appear on a rooftop ladder in Blue Gate. Resolved an issue where certain interaction icons could fail to appear during gameplay. Fixed "revived" events not being counted. Fixed an issue where the zipline interaction prompt could remain on a previously used zipline, preventing interaction with a new one; prompts now clear when out of range. Quick equip item wheel now has a stable layout and no longer collapses items towards the top when there are empty slots in the inventory. Updated in-game text across multiple languages based on localization review and player survey feedback. Added a cancel prompt when preparing to throw grenades and other throwable items. Fixed in-game input hints to match your current key bindings and show clear hold/toggle labels. Clarified binoculars hints when using aim toggle and updated hints for Snap Hook and integrated binoculars to support aiming. Tutorial hints now stay on screen briefly after you perform the suggested action to improve readability and avoid abrupt dismissals. Fixed an issue where input hints could remain on screen after being downed. HUD markers that are closer to the player now appear on top for improved legibility. Fixed issue where items sometimes displayed the wrong icon. Fixed issue where user hints were sometimes shown when spectating. Strongroom racks and power stations now display a distinct color when full of carryables to indicate that it has been completed. Fixed an issue where reconnecting to a match could leave your character in a broken state with incorrect HUD elements and a misplaced camera. Slightly delayed the initial loot screen opening and the transition from opening to searching during interactions. </>

Main Menu Added a Live Events carousel to the main menu and enabled click/hover interactions on the Raider Project overview. Fixed an issue where the Weapon Upgrades tab would sometimes change location. Resolved an issue where a Raider could pop in and out of the home screen background. Installed workstations no longer appear in the workstation install view. You can now navigate from on-screen notifications to the relevant screens, including jumping directly to learned recipes. The Upgrade Weapon Tab now accurately displays the magazine size increase. Fixed an issue where the map screen could become unresponsive when a live event was active. When inspecting items, rotating will now hide UI only showing the item being inspected. Free Raider Deck content now displays as “Free” instead of “0”. Added a carousel to the Main Menu featuring Quests and a Raider Deck shortcut, with improved gamepad navigation within the widget. Fixed an issue where the Scrappy screen allowed navigating to the quick navigation list when using a gamepad. </>

Quests Made pickups on the ground show icons if they are part of quests or tracked, added quest icons to quest interactions and improved quest interaction style. Fixed an issue where the notification could remain after accepting and claiming quests. Accepting and completing quests is now shown as loading while awaiting a server response. Fixed an issue where rapidly skipping through quest videos after completing the first Supply Depot quest could soft‑lock the UI, leaving the screen without a way to advance. Updated interaction text for a quest objective to improve clarity. Updated the names and descriptions of the Moisture Probe and EC Meter quest items in Unexpected Initiative. Improved ping information for quest objectives, with clearer markers for Filtration System and Magnetic Decryptor interactions. Adjusted colors of quest and tracking icons in in-game interaction hints for better clarity. </>

Settings Added a new slider that allows players to tweak motion blur intensity. Updated tooltips for effects and overall quality levels in the video settings with clearer descriptions. Added labels that show whether an input action is ‘Hold’ or ‘Toggle’, displayed in parentheses. Fixed an issue where the flash effect ignored the Invert Colors setting; the option is now available. Fixed a crash in settings when rapidly adjusting sliders. Now players will be guided to Windows settings for microphone permissions if needed. Social Fixed an issue where Discord friends could appear with an incorrect status after switching to Invisible and back to Online; their presence now refreshes correctly when they come back online. Added a Party Join icon to the social interface for clearer party invitations and joins. Fixed an issue where sticky throwables (Trigger 'Nade, Snap Blast Grenade, Lure Grenade) disappeared when thrown at trees. </>
Fixed a bug with incorrectly calculated deployment range for deployable items. </>
Fixed an issue where mines could not be triggered through damage before they were armed. </>
Playing an instrument now applies the ‘Vibing Status’ effect to nearby players. </>
Fix for Rubber Ducks not being able to be placed into the Trinket slot on an Augment. </>
Setting integrated binoculars and integrated shield charger weight to be 0. </>
Weapons </>
Lighter ARC are now pushed back slightly when struck by melee attacks. </>
Fixed an issue where stowed weapons would not appear on the first spawn. </>
Fixed an exploit allowing players to reload energy weapons without consuming ammo. </>
Aiming-down-sights now resumes if it was interrupted while the aim button is still held (e.g., after reloading or a stun). </>
Fixed an exploit that allowed shotguns to bypass the intended fire cooldown. </>
Quests </>
Fixed a bug in the ‘Greasing Her Palms’ quest that let players accidentally trigger an objective. </>
Made the quest item ESR Analyzer easier to find in Buried City. </>
Improved clarity of clues for the ‘Marked for Death’ quest. </>
Fixed an issue where quest videos could trigger multiple times. </>
Added interactions to find spare keys to several quests related to locked rooms. </>
Added unique quest items to the ‘Unexpected Initiative’ quest. </>
Fixed an issue where squad sharing incorrectly completed objectives that spawned quest specific items. </>
Known Issues </>
Players with AMD Radeon RX 9060 XT will see a driver warning popup at startup despite being on the latest version that fixes a GPU crash that occurred when loading into The Blue Gate. </>
If you have more items than fit in your stash, the value of the items that don't fit is not included in the final departure screen, but is included when calculating your rewards. </>

title: Wasp
text:
</>
 </>
 </>
Wasp </>
 </>
Shani: Nasty little buggers. Don't let them swarm you; aim for the thrusters, if you can. </>
 </>
Threat Level </>
Moderate </>
 </>
Armor </>
None </>
 </>
Primary Attack </>
Projectile Volley </>
 </>
Abilities </>
None </>
 </>
Weakness </>
Thrusters </>
 </>
Stats </>
 </>
Health </>
110 [ 1 ] </>
The Wasp is an agile ARC machine that's often observed flying in small swarms comprising of other Wasps and the occasional Hornet . </>
Combat </>
The Wasp will aim a red targeting laser before shooting a volley of projectiles. It remains stationary when firing. </>
Tips </>
Destroying two of a Wasp's thrusters may cause it to fall towards the ground. This can instantly destroy the Wasp if it drops from a great height. However, a Wasp with one missing thruster will fly much more erratically, making it more difficult to hit. </>
Avoid being spotted by moving behind cover or hiding in foliage. </>
Destroy it before it can lock onto you with its red targeting laser. </>
Loot </>
The Wasp Driver is a unique item dropped by the Wasp that's used to upgrade the Gunsmith . </>
Codex Entry </>
The Wasp is a small, thruster-powered drone, flying in tidy patrols with other Wasps and the occasional Hornet . When engaged, they switch to erratic flight patterns, making them a challenging target. They are equipped with light guns, and seem to actively scan for potential threats, sometimes mistaking humanoid statues for Raiders . </>
Wasps are often observed patrolling the skies in predictable patterns, seemingly serving as the first line of security for ARC 's probing and extraction operations. They scan for any human activity that could interfere with their operations, and seem drawn to areas with regular Raider activity. </>
The Wasp’s thrusters are exposed and unarmored, giving practiced Raiders a surefire way to send them crashing down. </>
While the innards of the drone are fairly simple, its central drive and power unit are worth tearing out. Raiders have shot at it for a makeshift explosive, and various tinkerers of Toledo have been known to use it to craft more advanced contraptions. </>
A Snitch can call in additional Wasps from orbit, posing a surprise threat to inexperienced Raiders — or a treasure trove of Wasp Drivers for those who come prepared. </>
References </>
↑ Health value is currently estimate, not based on a reliable source. </>

Water Troubles is a quest given by Celeste . </>
Objectives </>
In One Round </>
Locate the Flood Access Tunnel under the Red Lake Balcony </>
Find the intake to the District's Water Supply </>

Guide </>
Flood access tunnel is located on the outer wall of the dam </>

Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
If you're here to complain about the water, join the club. I've been fielding complaints all day. Something is definitely up with it, and I need some help to sort it out. </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
I've put up a reward for anyone who can get me a sample from the supply water intake. The sooner the better. </>
Idle: </>
It's always one thing after another with this place. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
Celeste here. The water intake is in the Flood Access Tunnel; one of the few places topside where the water's reliably clean. Or used to be, anyway. </>
Upon Completion: </>
Thanks. I'll have Lance take a look at this immediately. </>

title: Weapons
text:
Weapons are the primary tools used by players to damage ARC and other Raiders . Each weapon is classed within a different ammo type, and each ammo type has its own penetration value. The weapons also have classes, which changes their effectiveness in various combat scenarios. </>
Upgrades </>
Weapons can be upgraded at the Gunsmith to permanently improve their stats beyond their base level. </>
All but legendary guns have four levels of upgrades: I, II, III, IV. </>
Modifications </>
Modifications can be added to weapons to change how they shoot and handle. Different weapons mods work better on some guns, and worse on others, so make sure to equip the right weapon modification for the right scenarios. </>
See Weapon Modifications for a full list. </>

title: What We Left Behind
text:
</>
 </>
What We Left Behind </>
 </>
Trader </>
Tian Wen </>
 </>
Location </>
Dam Battlegrounds Buried City Spaceport </>
 </>
Related Quests </>
 </>
Previous </>
Dormant Barons </>
 </>
Next </>
Broken Monument </>
What We Left Behind is a quest given by Tian Wen . </>
Objectives </>
Find the mission objectives marked on the next locations: </>
On Buried City , search 2 containers in the Raider Camp beneath the Parking Garage. To reach the raiders camp, take the elevator zipline to the lower level buried in the sand. </>
On Dam Battlegrounds , search for anything significant in the South Swamp Outpost. </>
On Spaceport , search for anything significant in Bilguun's Hideout, next to the Container Storage. Is a tall structure next to the wall on the east side. </>
Rewards </>
1x Muzzle Brake II </>
1x Vertical Grip II </>
1x Stable Stock II </>
Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
Celeste told me you're the one who helped her hound me about pitching in more. I'll say this once: I don't appreciate the meddling, and I have my own reasons for refusing. I do however, appreciate the scrap. Since you're apparently good at tracking it down, I may have a task for you. </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
After the machines returned and forced us underground, the camps fell into disrepair, and now Raiders have picked most of them clean. I want you to scout a few for me. </>
Idle: </>
People sheltered in those camps, back then. Used the outposts to send messages and keep an eye on the ARC movements. Nothing like now. </>
Upon Completion: </>
I see. You can keep everything you found—just don't tell Celeste you've been rummaging around on my behalf, alright? I don't need her to breathe down my neck. I have some other places in mind too, so come back soon if you want to pocket some more coin. </>

With A Trace is a Quest given by Shani after completing Reduced To Rubble . </>
Objectives </>
Reach the Barren Clearing </>
Find signs of who brought down the ARC machines </>
Inspect the Adorned Wreckage </>
Inspect the communications device </>
Rewards </>
1x Looting Mk. 2 </>
1x Medium Shield </>
Dialog </>
Intro/Description: </>
That downed machine... We weren't the ones who did that. We know that there are still stray survivors out there, but this? This goes far beyond a single person. </>
Upon Acceptance: </>
See what you can find out about whoever [ 1 ] brought down that deforesting machine. We need to know whether they're friend or foe. </>
Idle: </>
We get new arrivals now and then, but they're usually parched and underfed. None of them could have brought down that Deforester. </>
Upon Entering Raid: </>
Hey—hold on. There. This is Shani: Whoever [ 1 ] brought down that Deforester, may have brought down other machines as well. See what you can find. </>
Upon Completion: </>
Thank you. This may help us find a way to contact them, assuming we can confirm that they're friendly. </>
Notes </>
↑ 1.0 1.1 Despite Shani saying "whoever", the subtitles read "whomever". </>

title: Workshop
text:
The Workshop lets you craft gear, weapons, items, and consumables. You start with the workbench, a free basic bench which enables you to craft basic weapons and most types of ammo , and Scrappy , the rooster which passively generates basic materials as you explore Topside . </>
Each workshop station requires different materials to build and upgrade (up to level 3) and unlocks more items which can be crafted. Certain items will need to be unlocked by learning their blueprint alongside a specific workbench level to be crafted. </>

Scrappy </>
This rooster has been a resident of the workshop since the day you moved in, and likely long before that. Will periodically bring back dubiously-sourced materials and share them with you. </>
Scrappy brings you Metal Parts , Fabric , Plastic Parts , Chemicals , Rubber Parts , and Assorted Seeds . </>
In the table below, you will see the rewards given to you by Scrappy based on his level, the minimum amount of time you spent in the raid, and if you extracted successfully or not. </>
You will need to spend at least 1 minute in a raid to receive anything. Surrendering 5 seconds in to a raid will not net you anything. </>
Surrendering 5 seconds in to a raid will not net you anything. </>
The maximum amount you receive is anything over 15 minutes in raid. Spending 15 minutes or 40 minutes will net you the same amount of rewards. </>
Spending 15 minutes or 40 minutes will net you the same amount of rewards. </>
The time is the time you spend in the raid and not how long the raid has been going. If you spawn in to a raid at 18 minutes remaining and extract at 11 minutes remaining in the raid, you will gain the resources for being in the raid for >6 minutes, and not >15 minutes. </>
If you spawn in to a raid at 18 minutes remaining and extract at 11 minutes remaining in the raid, you will gain the resources for being in the raid for >6 minutes, and not >15 minutes. </>
Note: Scrappy will hold up to 50x of each item, including Assorted Seeds , even though the UI shows Assorted Seeds as a stack-size of 100. </>
Values in table are base values. If you took the Expedition , your rewards will be almost 6% higher, but it is inconsistent. For around every 30 items you accumulate on Scrappy, you will get 1 extra of each item in your stash after claiming, up to a max of 50 after the expedition bonus. There is some inconsistency that is still being discovered, e.g. 20 or 26 items gives you +1, 48 gives you +2. </>

Blueprints </>
Blueprints are a core component of the Workshop system. They are used to craft specific items such as weapons, materials, and gadgets. </>
Blueprints are most reliably found in the loot containers of locked rooms, but can occasionally be rewards from quests. </>
A blueprint must be extracted before it can be used . Place it in your Safe Pocket to guarantee you'll be able to learn it. Once returned to Speranza, consuming the blueprint will add it to the relevant workshop station. </>
A previously learned blueprint will have a tick in the top-right corner of its icon, becoming easily distinguishable from unlearned ones. </>
